title: Need Advice: Wayfair vs JumpCloud Offer Comparison
content:
Hey folks, I need some advice on choosing between two offers:

Option 1: Wayfair
💰 CTC: 32 LPA + 1.9 LPA PF
🛠 Tech Stack: Java
🏢 Office: 3 days a week (fixed)

Option 2: JumpCloud
💰 CTC: 35 LPA + 1.7 LPA PF + ESOPs(6250units over 4 years)
🛠 Tech Stack: Go
🏢 Office: Fully Remote

My Thoughts:
Wayfair seems to be lowballing me, given my market expectations.
JumpCloud competes with Okta and is growing rapidly, which seems like an exciting opportunity.
I have more experience with Java, but I am open to learning Go if needed. Go demand is also growing
Work-life balance and flexibility are important to me.
Would love to hear your thoughts! Which one would you pick and why? Any red flags or things I should consider before making a decision?

Have asked wayfair match other offer

Thanks in advance! 🙌

title: Walmart SEIII | Zeta SDE2 | Banglore
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier1 college
Years of Experience: 2 year, 10 months (Currently working as an SDE2 at Unicorn startup)
Date of the Offer: March 2025


**Company: Walmart**
Title/Level: Software Engineer III (Equivalent to SDE2)
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: INR 23.6 LPA (Base + EPF)
Signing Bonus: INR 3.5 LPA
Stock bonus: INR 6 LPA **RSUs** vested over 3 years devided equally = INR 2LPA for 1st year
Bonus: Performance-based upto INR 4.5LPA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):  **INR 33.6 LPA**
Benefits: 30 paid vacation days + 25K fitness reimbursement yearly + 20k for medicines + cab services + Health Insurence + few other benifits
 
Other details: Hybrid work (3days office + 2 days WFH). Compensation negotiated once, original offer did not have signing bonus. 

I have accepted this offer and Joining date is one week later from now.




**Company: Zeta (Directi)**
Title/Level: SDE2
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: INR 32 LPA (Base + EPF)
Signing Bonus: INR 2 LPA
Stock bonus: INR 8 LPA **ESOPs**  vested over 4 years devided 10%, 20%, 30%, 40% = INR 80K for 1st year
Bonus: Performance-based upto INR 1LPA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):  **INR 35.8 LPA**
Benefits: 30 paid vacation days + Health Insurence  

Other details: 5 day work from Office. Office is 12km away so I will have to shift/relocate.
Note : Compensation under negotiation, expecting to finalize in 1-2 days



**Which one should I choose ??**

Walmart seems good to me in terms of name and benifits and considering I won't have to relocate but they are offering very less salary (specially the base component)

Should I try to negotiate this with walmart? How much should I ask and what are the chances they will consider it??

Considering 1st year component only, Although zeta is offering much better base, their over all compensation is almost equal to the walmart and Negative point is its 5 day work from office and I will have to relocate as well from my current location.

Under what condition should I consider Zeta over walmart?? How much more zeta should offer so that it can be accepted.

title: Urgent Help : Regarding Amazon Interview for Data Engineer
content:
Hi community,


I have my first-round interview scheduled with Amazon for the Data Engineer 1 role. The HR has mentioned the following topics in the invitation:


Coding: Basic scripting using Python, Scala, Java, etc. (any one)
Structured Query Language (SQL)
Leadership Principles: Learn and Be Curious, Dive Deep
I need some urgent guidance on the following:


To what extent should I prepare for DSA and SQL? Will it be medium-hard Leetcode-style questions, or should I expect something different?
Can I expect theoretical questions related to Python/SQL in the first round, or will it be purely problem-solving?
What kind of questions can I expect related to the two leadership principles mentioned?
Do I need to be prepared for questions related to my projects and past experience?
If anyone has recently given the interview for Data Engineer 1 at Amazon, please share your experience—it would be really helpful!
Thanks, community! Appreciate any insights.

content:
Education: B tech from tier-2 college
    Years of Experience: little less than 9 years
    Prior Experience: Senior engineer in reputed product based MNC

    Date of the Offer:  February 2025
    Company:      Nvidia
    Title/Level:  IC-4
    Location:     Bangalore
    Base salary: 49
    Signing Bonus: 0
    Stock bonus: 82 lakhs over 4 years
    Bonus: No Bonus
    Vesting schedule : 40 - 30 - 20 - 10
    Total comp:
     First Year:      81.8 lakhs
	 Second Year:     73.6 lakhs
	 Third Year:      65.4 lakhs
	 Fourth Year:     57.2 lakhs

Nvidia has recently changed the vesting schedule to be 40-30-20-10 and due to this they have reduced the overall RSU component in new offers.

They are not negotiating at all these days and sticking to their offers.

This offer is not comparable to other FAANG companines at all, so people interviewing or targeting NVIDIA, I would suggest to get your expectation discussed with recruiter upfront.

I engaged with them about a month for going through all interviews - 6 rounds.

Worst part is even after clearing all rounds their recruiter does not even disclose/discuss numbers verbally, Another 2 week for the recruiter to get the offer released and ended up rejecting this since I already had a better offer.

Here's the glimpse of the hardwork: grinding leetcode, regular participation(and upsolving) in the contests on Leetcode, learning system design, missing office parties, missing friends meetups, applying to jobs on various portals like a mad and offcourse facing a hell lot of rejections.

I've accepted the offer & have joined DocuSign as a Software Engineer.

title: Frontend Interview Prep: Machine Coding & System Design for Top Companies
content:
**This is the second time I am asking this question on LeetCode, as I did not receive any replies the first time. I believe this will be helpful not just for me but also for the community.**

I am currently working as an **SDE-2** as a Frontend Developer at an MNC with a base pay of 13.1L. I graduated in 2022 from a Tier-2 college (BMSCE). I want to deepen my frontend knowledge and transition into a top product-based company.

I understand that frontend interviews for such companies involve:
	1. Data Structures & Algorithms
	2. Machine Coding (Frontend System Design & Implementation)
	3. Frontend System Design (Scalability, Architecture, Performance, etc

**Questions:**
	1. What should be my structured roadmap for preparation?
	2. Which resources (blogs, courses, mock platforms) should I follow for E2E interview prep?
	3. How can I practice for the **Machine Coding round for UI-based problems**?
	4. What are some courses on **Frontend System Design** that I should follow to prepare for interviews at top companies?
	5. Any tips for excelling in the behavioral & hiring manager rounds?

I would really appreciate detailed guidance from experienced folks, as I believe this will also help others in the community. 
	-**Thanks in advance!**

- **Title/Level:** L61

- **Base Salary:** INR 33,00,000  
- **Relocation Assistance:** None (already residing in NCR)  
- **Signing Bonus:** INR 13,00,000 (7+6)  
- **Stock Bonus:** $100K stock grant vested over 4 years  
- **Performance Bonus:** Up to 20% of base salary annually  
- **Total Compensation (First Year):** ~60 LPA (Salary + Bonus + Stock)  
- **Benefits:** Standard Microsoft benefits  
- **Negotiation Outcome:** Initially offered $60K in stocks and a signing bonus of 5+5; after negotiation, the signing bonus increased, but the base salary remained unchanged.  

**Current Compensation:**  

- **Company:** MNC in Gurgaon  
- **Base Salary:** 40 LPA  
- **Stock Grants:** $42,000  

**Additional Notes:**  

1. The recruiter initially reached out for an L62 role. Though not actively seeking a job change, I decided to proceed with the interview.  
2. All interviews were conducted on the same day, and the offer was extended a week later.  
3. My first round didn't go well (likely why I was offered L61 instead of L62), but the rest of the interviews went well.  
4. I requested for additional interviews for L62, but the recruiter declined.  
5. The recruiter stated that 33 LPA base salary and a 13 LPA signing bonus were the highest possible for L61.  
6. The recruiter was uncooperative and barely allowed me to speak.

content:

title: Contract vs Permanent
content:
Hi Guys! please help me in choosing the right opportunity:
Total YOE : 10 years

1) Contract job : will have to work for late hours 3PM to 12PM IST for a FAANG company 
							Salary : 3L per month (fixed with no tax and no PF/Insurance/Gratuity etc and no job security)

title: Oracle (OHAI) vs Verve group. Please help !!
content:
Hello Leetcoders, Please help me in choosing the best offer. My priority is future growth with good learning opportunities.

YOE: 2.5 years
Tech stack : Java, Spring boot, Azure
Current org: Aviation PBC
Current CTC: 14.5 (base) + 1 (bonus)

I am currently holding 2 offers:

**Oracle (OHAI):**

Title/Level: IC2
Tech stack : Java
Salary: 22.6 LPA (PF included)
Stock Bonus: None
TC : 22.6 L

**Verve group:**

Title/Level: SDE-2
Tech stack : Golang (primary) + Java
Salary: 28 LPA (PF included)
RSU : Company will match 20% of the employee’s committed contribution to purchase shares.
Other benefits : 50k per year (Travel, fitness, shopping etc). Potential onsite chance after 2 years.
TC : 28.5 L

While I feel Oracle is a safe bet, I'm also looking for good learning opportunity. Verve is a Germany based company which is into ad tech domain & a good scale is involved. They are setting up the team in Bangalore. Only downside is it has got bad glassdoor ratings (3.2/5).

title: Uber | L5-A | Bangalore
content:
Giving back to the leetcode community.
I appeared for the Hiring Drive in Feb 2025. 

**1st Round - DS/Algo** (Working solution was expected)
There was a dependency graph given for tasks based on execution. I had to print out right order of execution of tasks for a given task.  

**2nd Round - DS/Algo** (Working solution was expected)
Modified number of island problem

**3rd Round - LLD** (Working solution was expected)
Design a task scheduling system. Task should have some executable which should be run when it is excuted.

**4th Round - HLD** 
Get nearest restaurants for a customer. 
The interviewer focused **only** on how to store the restaturant data in DB and get the nearest restaurants for a customer. The emphasis was on DB schema and APIs. 
Further questions - 
1. What will happen if there are hot spots
2. What will happen if there are no nearby restaurants.
I designed the system using cassandra with co-rodinate hash as partitioning and clustering key.
No discussion on scale happened. I had to specifically talk about scale and fail safes.

**5th Round - HM** 
Typical manegerial questions- 30 mins
Complicated design problem which I solved - 30 mins

title: Google L3 Chances | Interview Experience
content:
Hi , I recently interviewed for an L3 position at Google and would like to get feedback from fellow Googlers regarding my interview experience.

Note:- All the ratings(SH/LH/H) I mentioned below are from my experience only, not from recruiter.

Current Experience:- 1.6 Yrs (Software Engineer at Service Based Company)

Applied:- Recruiter reached out to me.

Phone Screening:- SH ( I solve complete problem without any hint and solved follow ups as well)

After the phone screening, I received feedback from HR saying that it was positive, and they wanted to move forward with the onsite interviews.

Onsite Round 1:- SH ( I solved the problem without hints, initially i give PBDS approach for which he said if I use PBDS I have to implement its function as well otherwise i have to change approach, then i solve it using other DS with TC and code, no followups).

Onsite Round 2:- H/LH ( I got stuck midway. Unfortunately I missed a hint in the problem constraints, and interviewer said I was close. But, after the hint, I solved the problem completely, including the code and time complexity.)

Onsite Round 3:- H/LH (I explained my approach and code it as well, but stuck on Time Complexity, wasted some time, then give final TC and he was satisfied with it, then solve 1 followup with code and TC, but he said he have one more followup which he couldn't ask due to time constraints).

G&L Round:- SH/H (The interviewer asked me general HR Questions and was satisfied with my answers, I believe it should be a SH).


Can anyone with experience provide feedback on whether I should expects a call for the next steps?

Other details: This is my first offer, and I didn't have anything to negotiate. I've already resigned—my current company was willing to match, but I declined as I wanted a fresh start. Do you think I should try during my notice period?

Reason for looking out:
I wasn’t getting any real learning opportunities, and the project was a complete mess—no testing, no code reviews, no best practices, and barely any time for testers (just one day for manual testing before production). This created a toxic work culture where fixing one bug often led to discovering more, due to the lack of proper testing. As a result, meeting committed timelines became nearly impossible. On top of that, I had to deal with incompetent coworkers.  

Would love to hear your thoughts!

title: Deliveroo || Delhivery || ScryAI || GeoServe
content:
I have cracked multiple offers from multiple companies , sharing some insights about my experience

Just a brief about me im a 2021 graduate did my btech from tier 2 college in Delhi . Started my prep from July 2024

**Offer 1**: Geoserve (Bangalore) , had 3 rounds 
* DSA (Medium level)
* Design (design architecture and database of an ecomm application catalogoue)
* Discussion with engineering Head (basic behaviour and situation based questions)


**Offer 2** : ScryAI (Gurgaon sector 48), 3 rounds
* Python Basics and advanced
* DSA and python basics (Stack based medium level question)
* HR and salary discussion

**Offer 3**: Delhlivery Gurgaon , 3 Rounds
* DSA and database basics (Coin change problem and SQL related questions)
* Low level Design Stack overflow
* Design Caching system , low level

**Offer 4:** Deliveroo Hyderabad, 4 Rounds
* Hacker Rank Test (15 MCQ)
* Take home assignment (Create a CRON String Parser)
* Live coding round add features to the cron string parser and explain the code
* Behavioural Round (Expect situation based questions)
* High level Design round :  Design a system to do a Giveaway of 6 million burgers in 10 mins, we need to ensure each users gets only 1 burger.

The RSU vesting cycle is 5% after Year 1, 15% after Year 2; and thereafter, 20% every six months until fully vested.
Other benefits includes :
Home internet reimbursement for up to INR 1,250 per month.
Meal card of INR 1,100 per month.
Medical insurance cover of INR 5,00,000 (family floater) for you and your dependents (spouse and up to two children).
Accident insurance cover for up to a maximum of three times annual base pay.
Life insurance cover for up to a maximum of four times annual base pay.
Annual health check which helps identify potential issues related to daily nutrition, fitness, and lifestyle habits.
5 days work from office

title: Oracle Cerner | PMTS | Banglore
content:
Education: BTech Computer Science
Years of Experience: 9
Prior Experience: SSE at Walmart Banglore
Current CTC - 41L Fixed + 8L Bonus (Variable) + 9L RSU (Vested over 4 years)
Date of the Offer: January 2025
Company: Oracle Cerner
Title/Level: Principle Member of Technical Staff
Location: banglore
Salary: INR 5600000
Relocation: 0
Signing Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: $75000 stock grant vested over 4 years (40%, 30%, 20% and 10%)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~INR 70 LPA Yearly (Including RSUs)
Other details: this is original offer, They did not do any negotiation.


**Interview Experience:**
had total 5 rounds
1. Screening round - 2 coding questions (LC medium) one of them was in a given array, find all the subarrays for a given sum
2. After ~20 days of screen round, i got a call to schedule next technical rounds. so 3 rounds were scheduled in a single day
3. Round 2 Round3 & Round 4
	4. All of the above round happenned in a single day
	5. All of the rounds, the interviewer asked LC medium coding questions and LLD coding questions like
		6. Design Hotel Management system
		7. Design Multi level Parking Lot
	8. Coding questions were mostly on Arrays, some of them what i remember are below:

* finding the subarray with maximum sum (In an array which has positivie and negative integers)
* in a sorted array return the majority element if any present

Last round was Hiring Manager round where we discussed about current tech stack, role etc, and some scenario based questions like how would you idenitfy the issue if there is some latency on your application APIs? how do you deploy your applications on production? what monitoring tool do you use for monitoring overall applicaiton performance etc.

title: HFT | Staff | 9.5 YOE | India
content:
Education: Tier 2 (Btech - CSE)
Years of Experience: 9.5 YOE
Prior Experience: 3 Startups
Current Comp: 90(base) + ESOPS


Month of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: HFT (Cant disclose)
Title/Level: Staff Frontend
Location: Bengaluru
Fixed Salary: Rs 95 LPA
Signing Bonus: 10 lakhs
Perf Bonus: 20% - 30%
Total First year TC (Salary + Bonus + Joining):  1.25Cr ~ 1.35Cr

Personally it almost feels like a lateral move wrt pay as my fixed pay is almost the same, but I get actual money instead of paper money at the end of the year. I have also been approached by Google for L5 role, right after I have finished all my rounds in this company. But given this offer is almost close to L5 level and that the bonus component in HFTs can get really high for top performers after proving their skills, I have decided not to go ahead with the process. Not to mention the layoffs, politics for L6 promotion and huge waiting times for team matching at Google.

~~I also think I have reached the cliff when it comes to IC role comp and~~ I want to settle in a stable company without worrying about layoffs or funding issues (startups).

title: Samsara | Senior Software Engineer | Bangalore
content:
Education: B.Tech Tier-1 College
Years of Experience: 7.5 years
Prior Experience: Senior at one of the FAANG level companies
Date of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: Samsara
Title: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore
Salary/Base: ₹58,00,000 (including PF)
Annual Bonus: ~₹5,60,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: ₹1.23 cr vested equally over 3 years (33%, 33%, 34%)
Total Comp: Roughly 1.05cr

This was their initial offer, didnt negotiate as i planned to go ahead with another offer, but the way recruiter was talking, it seemed like they wouldnt move much. 

Note: They are setting up a new office in Bangalore, they are starting with a team of 30 SWEs but plan to scale to 200+ in the next couple of years. Their country head mentioned that Bangalore is planned to be their second biggest office after Seattle. Work seemed good.

I asked for a JB as well, they mentioned that Samsara doesnt give JBs yet but they have raised this with the Finance team and plan to soon add a JB component as well. So their pay should increase a little in the upcoming days. Seems like they are losing candidates because of not giving JB :)

title: Microsoft | Consultant | L56 | Fresher | Hyderabad
content:
**Years of Experience**: 0  
**Education**: B.E. in Computer Science Engineering from a Tier 3 College  
**Company**: Microsoft  
**Role/Level**: Consultant (L56)  
**Placement Type**: On-campus (Pool drive across multiple colleges)  
**Date of Offer**: October 2023 (4th Year of B.E.)  
**Joining Date**: May 2024  
**Location**: Hyderabad (Fixed)

### Compensation Details:

- **Signing Bonus**: ₹1,00,000 INR  
- **Base Pay**: ₹10,60,000 INR  
- **Relocation Bonus**: ₹3,00,000 INR (non-taxable) + ₹41,000 INR (one month basic pay)  
- **Stocks**: 4,000 USD (vested over 4 years)  
- **Performance Bonus**: 0-20% of base salary  

### Benefits:

- **Health and Hobby Reimbursement (Perks+)**: ₹30,000 INR  
- **Food Credits**: ₹200 per day  
- **Medical Insurance**: ₹5 Lakh employee + parents medical insurance (additional flex points available to increase this to ₹7 Lakh or convert them to Perks+)  
- **Transportation**: Buses and cabs to and from office  
- **Joining Kit and Goodies**: Year-end, participation, and team-specific rewards


In addition to the salary, both the employee and employer's contribution to the Provident Fund (PF) will be deducted from your monthly salary. Apart from this, you also receive a component called GP (Global Allowance), which is around ₹1,36,000 INR in your first salary. The entire tax for the year is deducted based on the tax regime (new or old) chosen, and the tax amount is approximately equivalent to the GP component of ₹1,36,000 INR. Therefore, you can consider that you won’t need to pay any tax in the first year, as the GP covers the entire tax amount. Please note that the GP component is not mentioned in the offer letter.

**In your first year, you also have the opportunity to visit Microsoft’s Seattle office for a 3-4 day event called "Accelerate", which is specially designed for new hires. This seven-day trip is fully reimbursed by Microsoft.**

*After accounting for PF and all other deductions, your take-home salary in the first year is approximately ₹78,000 INR per month.*

title: Amazon | DE1 | Bengaluru
content:
**Education:** B.Tech in Computer Science  
**Years of Experience:** 0 years  
**Internship Experience:** 6 months (Amazon, Data Engineer Intern)  
**Prior Experience:** Interned at Amazon  

**Offer Details:**  
- **Company:** Amazon  
- **Title/Level:** Data Engineer I  
- **Location:** Bengaluru, India  
- **Date of Offer:** January 2025  

### Compensation:  
- **Base Pay (INR):** ₹15,34,000  
- **Sign-on Bonus:**  
  - Year 1: ₹4,23,000  
  - Year 2: ₹3,81,000  
- **Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) Value (INR):** ₹10,93,000 (vested over 4 years)  
  - Vesting schedule:  
    - 5% after Year 1  
    - 15% after Year 2  
    - 20% every six months thereafter until fully vested  

- **Relocation (INR):** ₹1,50,000  

**Total Compensation (First Year):**  
Base Pay + Sign-on Bonus (Year 1) + RSUs (First Year Vesting)  
= ₹15,34,000 + ₹4,23,000 + ₹54,650 (5% of ₹10,93,000)  
= **₹20,11,650**  

**Total Compensation (4 Years):**  
Base Pay (4 years) + Sign-on Bonus (2 years) + Full RSU Value  
= ₹15,34,000 \xD7 4 + ₹4,23,000 + ₹3,81,000 + ₹10,93,000  
= **₹75,55,000**  

### Benefits:  
1. **Annual Leave:**  
   - 15 working days of annual leave per financial year  
   - 12 calendar days of sick leave per financial year  
   - 12 calendar days of casual leave per financial year  
   - 10 mandatory and optional holidays per calendar year  

2. **Transportation Allowance:**  
   - Tier 1 cities (Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Chennai, Mumbai, NCR, Kolkata): ₹4,000/month  
   - Other cities: ₹1,500/month  

3. **Home Internet Reimbursement:** Up to ₹1,250/month  
4. **Meal Card:** ₹1,100/month  
5. **Insurance:** Standard Amazon insurance benefits .

title: BNY Mellon | 2025 Summer Software Intern | On-Campus
content:
### **Round 1: Online Assessment**
- **Format:** 4 Coding Questions
  - **1 Easy**
  - **2 Medium**
  - **1 Hard**

---

### **Round 2: In-Person Interview**
- **Topics Covered:**
  - **Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA):**
    - 1 Easy Question (focused on Python proficiency using in-built functions)
    - 2 Medium Difficulty Questions
  - **Aptitude:** 1 Question
  - **SQL:** 1 Question
  - **Machine Learning:**
    - 1 Question requiring a solution and code implementation to be written on a blank sheet
    - 3-5 Verbal Questions (based on projects)
  - **Technical Questions:**
    - 2-3 Questions on web development frameworks
  - **Resume-Based Questions:** 5+ Questions

---

### **Round 3: In-Person Interview**
- **Topics Covered:**
  - **DSA:** 4 Questions (Easy to Medium Difficulty)
  - **AI Case Studies:** 2-3 Scenario-Based Questions
  - **System Design:** 1 Easy Question

---

### **Internship Details**
- **Duration:** May 2025 - August 2025
- **Office Locations:** Pune or Chennai
- **Compensation:**
  - **Monthly Stipend:** ₹75,000
  - **One-Time Travel Allowance:** ₹15,000

**Note:** Solution to all DSA questions was required to be written on a blank sheet of paper infront of the interviewer.

title: Porter Interview Experience | SDE 2 | Oct 2024 | Bangalore
content:
Hello,
I had got the opportunity to interview at Porter for SDE 2 position for Bangalore office in Oct 2024. Got this opportunity from naukari (not applied directly).

**Previous experience:** 3.7 YOE in a young company.

**Round 1: Screening Round**
Asked about my current and preivous work experience, Insights into my technical knowledge of java, databases, microservices.

They wanted to check if i fit there technical and functional criterion.

**Round 2: DSA Round**
Two DSA questions

Q1. Group anagrams: https://leetcode.com/problems/group-anagrams/description/

Q2. Word Break: https://leetcode.com/problems/word-break/description/

Able to solve both within time.

**Round 3: Design Round**

In my experience they had asked one of the realistic question for LLD round, where the question was not a regular question and had involved critical thinking and design skills.

Implement this system,

Imagine we have an e-commerce product - a simpler version of the Amazon app.

Current customer flow:
Customers can search and select products.
* Products can be added to the cart.
* Once added to the cart, customers can check out the products. Order placed is visible in the app with the latest status. 
* Payment mode available is only offline after delivery.

Current backend systems:
* Catalog/Product Service: Manages the product life cycle, including creation and retrieval of products.
* Cart Service: Handles operations related to user carts, such as adding and removing items. Each user can have only one cart.
* Order Service: Manages order creation and updates status. It does not include a payment system, as payments are handled on delivery.

New Product Requirement:
* The product team wants to introduce a new feature - a Coupon system. 
* Initially, the system should support a single coupon:
	* A coupons tab will be visible in the checkout page in App which will show all the applicable coupons to the customer.
	* Introducing only a single coupon - 10% discount applied to the 11th order.
	* This coupon can only be used once per user, and it can be redeemed only once in a lifetime.
	* The coupon should be available to the user again if the transaction fails.

The type of coupon is not limited to just discount coupon. There could be other types as well. for ex
1. Get flat Rs 100 off on first order.
2. Get 10% discount on order above Rs 1000 
3. Avail cashback of 5% upto Rs 50 on the next order.
4. Get a 15% discount on SBI / HDFC / Any card.
5. Buy 2 get 1 for all the shirts of some type.

Basically there can be any type of coupon which can be applied on the cart if the conditions are satisifed (like first order)

Think about the system in generic manner.

My solution after lot of discussions and even after interview

```
I will create a new microservice like coupon-service just like a order service. This microservice will handle CRUD ops on coupons, validate coupon, apply coupon etc.

User journey
Cart Page > Checkout > List of Coupons  > Apply Coupon

Entities

1. class Coupon
		String couponId
		String code
		Enum type: USER_LEVEL / PRODUCT_LEVEL
		String description
		List<Condition> conditions
		List<Reward> rewards
		Date lastValiditiyDate
		Enum status: APPLIED, EXPIRED, AVAILABLE

2. class Condition
	String conditionId

	2.1 class OrderCondition extends Condition
		Integer noOfOrder

	2.2 class CartCondition extends Condition
		Integer cartValue

	2.3 class PaymentCondtion extends Condition
		Card card

	2.4 class ProductType extends Condition
		ProductType productType

3 class Reward
	String rewardId

	3.1 class DiscountReward extends Reward
		Integer discountPercent
		Optional<Integer> uptoLimit
		Enum type: FLAT / UPTO / ...

	3.2 class CashbackReward extends Reward
		Integer cashbackAmount
		Optional<Integer> uptoLimit

	3.3 class VoucherReward extends Reward
		Integer voucherId

Coupon Microservice will expose some APIs

1. CRUD APIs for Coupon
2. Get List of available coupons
	GET /coupons/list?cartId=?&userId=?
3. Apply coupon
	POST /coupons/apply
	Request Body: {
		String cartId
		String couponId
	}
	Response Body: 
	200 OK {
		String message;
		payload: {
			List<Reward> rewards
		}
	}
	400 Bad Request {
		String message
	}

```
Although the solution that i gave is still not generic and requires extension whenver any type of coupon or condition or reward comes in.

Plus, this too is a much refined solution and I thought about list of condition and rewards in coupons at the near end of interview after many hints.

Final Verdict: Rejected

Ps: If anyone have a solution (maybe better or less better) please comment, so that even i can get some more idea on it?

title: Juspay vs Branch International - Which one to choose ?
content:
Need Help
College - Tier3 (2025 Batch)
Got multiple offers but, 2 major:

1) SDE Intern + PPO at Juspay
* Intern 40k / month from Bangalore
* Need to leave my city 
* PPO is already confirmed for (Associate SDE i.e. SDE1) and is good enough

2) SDE Intern (ML) at Branch International
* Intern 51k / month completely remote 
* PPO is subject to performance and company's needs completely.
* PPO range not clearly communicated despite asking multiple times.

Which one to choose ? Key considerations:
* Career growth in the early years
* Learning + Tech Stack
* Compensation (obviously)

I was thinking to go with Juspay considering the organisation reputation, learning curve and everything but the only problem is internship stipend is not very competitive and I have to leave my hometown for it but the PPO is great.

please help !!

title: TomTom Internship Expirience
content: The Internship  selection process involved shortlisting students based on CGPA, followed by interviews that tested my knowledge in SQL, Java, C++, and DSA. I began my six-month internship in June, which continued until December. During the internship, I had the opportunity to work on a cutting-edge technology stack, including Java, Spring, and Azure,Apache Spark,Apache Airflow,Python.\n\nI\u2019m thrilled to share that after successfully completing the internship, I\u2019ve been offered the position of Software Engineer 1 at TomTom with a total CTC of 16 LPA, comprising a base salary of 14 LPA, with no stocks or signing bonus. Grateful for this incredible journey and looking forward to the opportunities ahead!

content:

title: URGENT HELP NEEDED ON - Qualcomm vs Current Job (WFH)
content:
YOE: 4.4.
CCTC: 22 LPA.
Company: Working in a Service based for last 2 years.
Current work mode: Permanent WFH.

Received this offer from Qualcomm:-
Gross Salary + Retirals - INR 27 L
Joining RSU - 15k USD
Performance RSU - 9.75k USD
Performance Bonus - 1.87 Lakh
Locations - Bangalore, India.

HR is very strict on Negotiations. HR informed me about the numbers before proceeding with the application. I tried to negotiate post the offer but there are no scope for negotiations.

I'm pretty comfortable working from home which gives me lots of flexibility in work. But at the same point of time, I want to work in more impactful project in a reputed company which will definitely improve my resume. 

Considering the current job market where resume getting shortlisted itself a challenge & big task, it's very crucial to work on projects with more impact and that's the reason I interviewed at Qualcomm. But the compensation they offered is not ideal and since there won't be any gain in-hand considering all the expenses at Bangalore and there are uncertainty about the work culture too at Qualcomm.

I'm in complete dilema and need your help. 

**PLEASE provide your valuable suggestions & upvote, so that it reaches the maximum audiences who can help me !!**

content:

Date of the Offer: November 2024
Company: Google
Level: L4
Location: Bangalore
Round : 
Base : 35 lacs
Retirals: ~3 lacs (pf + gratuity)
Signing Bonus: 8 lacs
Relocation Bonus : ~5 lacs
Stock bonus: $99k (38%,32%,20%,10%) -> 83.5 Lacs : 1st yr -> 31.73 lacs
Target bonus: 15% -> (5.2 lacs)
Total comp for 1st year(Salary + Stock + Retirals + Signing + relocation + annual bonus): 87.93 LPA

Total comp for 2nd yr : ~70 LPA

Note : Few important points :
1. I had to negotiate with my recruiter to interview for an L4 role, initially the recruiter didn't agree, but I asked her to keep it open and based on my interview please try to push for a L4 role, as my years of experience was qualified for a L4 role in theory. In a lot of cases recruiter for L3 and L4 are different, then it might be tough to negotiate.

2. The recruiter was good, she clearly said : If and only if I get hire and strong hire in every rounds + if the team I get a match with shares some Letter of Recommendation for L4 role,  only then there is a chance for approval of L4 role from Hiring Committee.

3. My rounds were : 
	* Screening : H [Not counted for evauation]
	* 1st Round : H [Few remarks : unconventional but correct solution]
	* 2nd Round : SH 
	* 3rd Round : SH 
	* Googlyness : H

Matched with the first team, the Director did thoroughly scrutinised my design skills , work I did in current company and things on my resume and later the recruiter said that he will share the LOR for L4. 

Offer Status : Accepted

Please subscribe to my youtube channel :
[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1VLjyUYf43ub7sYUr65S8w
)
I will start sharing some in depths content on :
* Resume that got me through : Uber  , Tiktok (Singapore) , Cred , Zepto , Google and lots of other MNC's and startups.
* Preparation Strategy : From Scratch to Software Engineer 2 (L4)
* Google Specific Prepation Strategy
* Backend Engineering : More and more about less and less -> Starting from what is  internet, which I see a lot of people working in backend and frontend don't know.
* How to negotiate for some good joining bonus etc.

I mentor a lot of people from college, current company and other levels personally, still planning on all of these stuffs, I have some personal commitments and bandwidth crunch, if I see some good resposne on the youtube channel,  I will definitely try to spend some time on these contents as well.

Meanwhile , I will keep posting on Leetcode , as and when I get some time. 

Thank you.

title: Salesforce MTS Offer
content:
Education: B.Tech CS in Tier-2 College
Years of Experience: 2.4 years
Prior Experience: SDE 1 at Saas startup
Date of the Offer: Oct 2024
Company: Salesforce (Service cloud)
Role : Backend developer
Previous techstack : Java spring boot
Title: MTS (Member of technical staff)
Location: Bangalore (flexible according to team, no rigid rules like come to office 3 times a week)
Salary/Base: ₹32,00,000
Bonus: ₹3,20,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: $50,000 for 4 years (equally vested)
Total Comp: ₹45,70,000
Previous CTC: ₹24,00,000 (₹20,00,000 Base + ₹4,00,000 ESOPs per year)
Benefits: Standard salesforce benifits 
LC/CP states : around 850 questions on LC, 500 on CF (used to do in college), knight in lc , CF max rating specialist, 4 star on CC. Haven't solved much in atcoder.
Preparation strategy: 
Algorithms : 
    Used to solve leetcode regularly in year starting and gave contests to keep my coding skills sharp. When my interviews got scheduled I just went through some standard medium/Hard problems. For most of the companies doing leetcode is enough. But please do questions in depth rathar than doing it for increasing the count of questions. Please give contests on LC. Always try to attempt harder questions than your current level. 
System design : 
     For LLD I have gone through online blogs and youTube but mainly I frame my answers according to my learnings till now. Ideally at 2+ years exp you are already aware of most of the basics of LLD so go through the basics of LLD and then apply your day to day Dev skills to frame the answer (please refer some standard questions online and then frame the answer that way). 
	 For HLD you can follow CodeKarle youTube channel, that covers all the basics of hld and he has covered all the standard questions. You can watch those and form your solutions according to that because any question can be answered using basics of hld and standard questions that are already available on youtube.

One more important note please give some mock interviews for algorithms and system design both and do not take hr round very lightly, please prepare for behavioural questions seriously before your hr/hm round. 

How Did I apply : I applied thourgh referral, one of college seniors referred me in August end.
Other companies that I interviewed with : Zepto and got a call from Goldman for associate but my joining date was already very near by that time. Got ghosted by Zepto after two rounds. 

Accepted the offer as I am getting very good hike according to my current TC(and good tag on resume) and didn't get to interview with any other company which can beat this TC. My only concern is if sf has good work or not (have read some online reviews that work is not that good here). Will add interview exp in future.

title: Is only DSA enough for 4-5 YOE? Sorry for posting here :P
content:
I’m asking this on behalf of a friend. He’s from a Tier-1 college and has 4.5 years of experience. He’s worked at a couple of good product-based companies and is now looking for a switch.

The problem is, while he’s amazing at DSA, that’s pretty much where it ends. His work so far has mostly been on legacy products, which involved a lot of bug-fixing but no real opportunities to build anything or work on modern frameworks. He only knows C++ and some basic Java, and he’s never done any proper development work.

He’s really scared right now and feels like he’s wasted these 4.5 years in a chill environment that didn’t challenge him enough. He’s worried that no good company will hire him due to lack of proper development experience.

Any advice for someone in his situation? Also, if he does manage to crack an interview, what kind of CTC can he realistically expect? His current CTC is 28 LPA (26 base).

title: Hey Coach claiming to place me with 70 LPA to 1 CPA CTC
content:
Hey Folks, 

I am preparing for interviews and solving DSA, learning about System Design etc. I have been able to crack companies paying me 42 LPA CTC (35 as base). I have around 4 years of experience. 

I got a call from Hey Coach. They are gonna charge 1.6 lakhs (EMI option available too) and enrol me in their interview preparation batch. They will train me on DSA, System Design, Resume building etc and claim to get me placed in companies like MAANG, Paypal with more than 70 LPA. He also claimed that he will try to refer me to the companies paying 65-70 as base and my overall CTC will be more than 1 CR. 

The course timeline will be 4 months. Is it worth going for? I know it is, if they are actually true in what they are claiming. I just wanted to know if someone or someone you guys know has got this much compensation via Hey Coach. Please help me out here. 

I am preparing for the interviews and my goal was to join a stable company paying me around 45 LPA as base. I have already reached till 35. But now I am being greedy lol.

content:

Help me out in choosing Google vs Coinbase FTE offers.

### Offer Comparison: Coinbase (IC3) vs Google (L3)

| Category                   | Coinbase                                  | Google                                      |
|----------------------------|-------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------|
| **Offer Date**             | October 2024            | December 2024                              |
| **Role**                   | Software Engineer (IC3)                  | Software Engineer (L3)                     |
| **Location**               | Remote (Bangalore, India)                | Onsite (Bangalore, India)                  |
| **Base Salary**            | ₹26,75,000                                | ₹21,00,000                                 |
| **Signing Bonus**          | N/A                                       | ₹3,25,000                                  |
| **Bonus**                  | 5% of Base (₹1,33,000)                   | 15% of Base (~₹3,15,000)                   |

| **Benefits**               | 1.25L WFH Setup + 10L Medical Insurance + Connection & T&E Stipends | Google Benefits + Similar Benefits                     |

title: (Don't interview with) Paytm | SSE | Unprofessional and Unethical
content:
Current - SDE2 at a Banking company
Fixed: 20 LPA
Experience: 3+ years

I recently interviewed with Paytm for SSE role and had clearly communicated the recruiter about the offers I was currently holding. Even after clearing all the rounds with highest ratings (I got to know later), they made me wait for more than a week, eventually to tell me that the company has recently made a policy to not offer more than 30% hike on the current compensation irrespective of the offers a candidate holds (contradictory from what the recruiter communicated earlier).

While I appreciate and respect the policies a company abides by, they should not really waste a candidate's time especially when they are serving their notice period already and they could spend this precious time interviewing with other companies.

Now, they have just stepped back and not even making an offer, and the recruiter just ended the call saying - "we are sorry".

Guys, paytm as a company is just going down (heard from their current employees as well regarding appraisals, promotions, etc) and if they keep perfoming like this, they are surely going to lose on a lot of good talent. 

If you are already in the 20 LPA range and expecting anything even slighly above 26 LPA, please do not waste your precious time interviewing with them. Extremely unprofessional and unethical procedures.

title: Another Journey story (with study material)
content:
Target audience: 2023 to 2026 grads.

Taking inspiration from https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6108545/Journey-From-6-LPA-To-60-LPA & writing about my journey. Also I would add some references that helped me grow.

I am 2020 grad from a tier 2 state level college (All NITs, IIITs, BITs, new IITs, state level top colleges are tier 2 to me). During college days, I expertised in ML & DL.

Sept 2020: I started my journey in a data consulting company in a Data science + Data engineering role. Salary: < 9 LPA.
During my stay here, I started studying DSA. Participated proper hackathons where I understood how to make CRUD apps & how backend & frontend interacts. I also learnt about databases. I was rejected by Amazon badly around May 2021.

Study materials used by me to switch to next role:
1. DSA: Many youtubers.
2. ML: Coursera (deeplearning.io), articles on internet. Many youtubers are there.

Dec 2021: Joined a product company as ML Engineer. Salary: 15-18 LPA range. I started studying more about ML & DL. This was the time when GPT 3 was getting popular & I deep dived the world of NLP. Also I was practicing DSA passively.
I decided to switch because alot of layoff news were coming in May 2022 & I wanted to increase my pay before market shuts.

Study materials used by me to switch to next role:
1. Designing data-intensive applications by Martin Kleppmann
2. Designing Machine Learning Systems by Chip Huyen
3. DSA: https://www.youtube.com/@takeUforward
4. Data engineering: PySpark, Hadoop concepts on internet.
5. ML: Many youtubers, can refer https://www.youtube.com/@statquest for fundamentals. Also multiple blogs on internet.
6. Famous research papers related to computer vision & NLP.

Dec 2022: I finally joined a good product company & failing in a lot of interviews because of bad market conditions. My role here was MLOps & Data engineering. Salary: 35 LPA range with 23-25 fixed + RSUs & bonus. 
Here , for the first time, I understood how real time ML inference services works & how we scale it to serve huge customer base. My data engineering knowledge base also increased exponentially. Parallely, LLMs came to limelight in 2022 & I deep dived into the world of LLMs.

Jan 2024: I got interview call for Google for SWE, MLE, L4 role. I started focusing more on DSA, ML System design & ML concepts ranging from classical algos to LLMs.

Study materials used by me to switch to Google:
1. ML System design: https://bytebytego.com/intro/machine-learning-system-design-interview + more which I got through my work.
2. ML concepts list: https://shubajit.notion.site/SWE-MLE-Google-FAQs-c3f87ea136dd4c779645ee22c6b96779 + more which I got through my work.
3. DSA: https://www.youtube.com/@takeUforward, same as before. You can refer to any source of your choice.
4. LLM basics: https://www.coursera.org/learn/generative-ai-with-llms
5. LLM advanced: Read research papers & articles.

Aug 2024: Joined Google. Pay: Standard L4 pay that you see on any other recent leetcode compensation post.

Dec 2024: I am facing a challenging*WLB here, but pay & food is great. Also people are very smart.

Thanking leetcode community which is continuously helping me grow.
Also thanking leetcode compensation section which always made me feel that their is still scope of betterment (somedays made me feel that I am broke).

Message to someone who is 4 years younger to me: Hustle 70 hours a week. Not entirely for office work, study for your growth 50% of the time.

title: Journey From 5 LPA To 50 LPA
content:
This is not a brag post, just a reminder for anyone who might need a bit of motivation. The journey isn't always smooth, but persistence and hard work pay off.

Effective YOE: 5.5 years
(Note: The names of the companies have been kept anonymous for privacy reasons.)

June 2019: Graduated from a Tier-2 college with an on-campus placement at Organisation A, securing a package of ~5 LPA.

March 2021: After spending almost two years at Organisation A, I felt like I had outgrown my role. I was eager to work on more challenging projects and get exposure to different technologies, so I made the decision to switch companies. I joined Organisation B, accepting an offer of ~8 LPA — a modest increase, but it was the right move for my career.

March 2022: After a year at Organisation B, I was able to learn a lot, but I realized I wanted to work in a more dynamic environment with a faster growth trajectory. I knew it would be challenging, but I decided to take another leap. I switched to Organisation C and accepted an offer of ~15 LPA. I was focused on upskilling and expanding my expertise.

March 2024: At Organisation C, I worked hard to prove myself, consistently delivering results and taking on more leadership responsibilities. It paid off. By the end of the year, I had grown my package to ~25 LPA after a successful performance review and promotion.

November 2024: I decided it was time for another challenge. After multiple interviews and offers, I ended up accepting an offer from Organisation D — a leading company in the industry, with a base package of ~50 LPA (45 LPA base + 5 LPA bonus). The process was tough, but it felt incredibly rewarding to see how far I'd come.

**Final Thoughts:**
The journey wasn’t easy, and there were plenty of doubts and setbacks. But persistence, consistent effort, and a willingness to adapt made all the difference.


If you’re feeling stuck or demotivated, remember this: your current situation does not define your future. With focus, hard work, and determination, you can turn things around and achieve more than you ever imagined. Keep learning, stay resilient, and never stop striving toward your goals. The best is yet to come!

Dec 2022: I finally joined a good product company & failing in a lot of interviews because of bad market conditions. My role here was MLOps & Data engineering. Salary: 35 LPA range with 23-25 fixed + RSUs & bonus. 
Here , for the first time, I understood how real time ML inference services works & how we scale it to serve huge customer base. My data engineering knowledge base also increased exponentially. Parallely, LLMs came to limelight in 2022 & I deep dived into the world of LLMs.

Jan 2024: I got interview call for Google for SWE, MLE, L4 role. I started focusing more on DSA, ML System design & ML concepts ranging from classical algos to LLMs.

title: Lets bet on the winning horse: NVIDIA
content:
Hi Guys,
(Read below lines like your bestfriend is sharing his story with you so that you avoid evil thinking like bragg kar raha hai)
I was a state merit holder in class 12 with 91% in PCM & wanted to pursue my higher education from some good college out of my hometown but due to some reason i stayed back in my hometown & did B.Tech from local college.

My friends setting beside me often asked me that what's the faayda of 91% if you are sitting with 60% folks , well there are lot of faayda's :). I clearly told my father that don't expect me to score the same as i will learn practical knowledge in college.

Hacked college website, always a back bencher, played lots and lots of counter strike, enjoyed to the fullest, back to back 3 times state merit holder, was always asked to leave the class, often presented in front oh HOD due to hacking, HOD gave me the advance CS labs keys so that i can be stopped from breaching. In short i am gratefull to god for this amazing rich experience. Always stayed far from girls & never let my friend bring in any girl into the group.

My first company was service based 3 LPA. I worked for 2 great companies like akamai, cisco.

I always believed that whatesoever you do with interest will always be fruitful & strictly against DSA (frankly didn't liked it). 

Today i am holding a very good offer from nvidia(without-DSA) & to give back to community (moreoever sharing my feeling), i am listing my offer details below:
- - -
Current Compensation: 
**IC3**:
* YOE: **5.5 years**
* Base: **22 LPA**
* No Stocks
- - - 
Offered from Nvidia Pune:
**IC3**
* Base : **30 LPA**
* Joining Bonus: **4 LPA**
* Relocation bonus: **2 LPA**
* Stock: **50 LPA**
* Total Compensation: **86 LPA**

- - -
**Other offers**
I was holding offer from amazon as-well & in interview with other companies as-well for 50 LPA as base but i think the stock growth potential in nvidia , work-life balance & job-safety is high compared to any other company out there. 

I am in rounds with Google as well (L4) but even if google offers 35-40 base and $80000 as stock, nvidia will still skyrocket my wealth because in span of just 9 months nvidia stock has gave a return of 400% & last split was in june 10:1 compared to 1.5:1 some years back. 

Its the decision which makes us & decides our future, let's see where this decision takes me.

Thanks to all folks who shared offer insights so that we can have a reference & ask for better always.

title: Journey From 6 LPA To 60 LPA
content:
This is not a brag post. I just want to share some motivation for anyone who might need it.

Effective YOE: 5.5 years
Note: The names of the organisations have been hidden purposefully for anonymity.

July 2017: Graduated from a Tier-1 college with an on-campus placement at Organisation A, securing a package of ~14 LPA.

March 2019: Left Organisation A due to a lack of interest in software engineering and a desire to explore other opportunities. Started my own business.

March 2020: Realized things weren’t going well and decided to return to a stable software engineering job. Unfortunately, COVID-19 hit, making it a challenging time to secure employment.

February 2021: Applied to numerous companies but received no interview calls. Finally got an offer of 6 LPA (less than half of my previous compensation) from Organisation B in February 2021, which I accepted due to a career break and lack of confidence.

October 2021: Began studying diligently and worked hard to upskill. Successfully cracked multiple offers, the highest being 30 LPA.

June 2022: Accepted the 30 LPA offer from Organisation C and continued putting in significant effort.

March 2024: Earned a promotion, and my package increased to ~39 LPA.

November 2024: Once again cracked multiple offers, ultimately accepting a 60 LPA offer (50 LPA base + 10 LPA bonus) from Organisation D.

Final Thoughts
The journey wasn’t easy, and there were plenty of doubts and setbacks. But persistence, consistent effort, and a willingness to adapt made all the difference.

If you’re feeling stuck or demotivated, remember this: your current situation does not define your future. With focus, hard work, and determination, you can turn things around and achieve more than you ever imagined. Keep learning, stay resilient, and never stop striving toward your goals. The best is yet to come!

Edit: Seeing a lot of backlash on this post about being fake. Adding a post which I created a year ago about the switch in 2022. I don't need to prove anything to anyone but just want that the person who needs this, gets this, without thinking if this is fake. if I can do it, you can do it too
https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/4123131/Optum-or-Senior-Software-Engineer/

Couldn't have planned to fake it a year ago XD

It's  a great salary, especially for such low level position to live very comfortably in Prague, but I will aim for level up by the end of 25.

title: Fivetran vs. inMobi Offer Comparison [Urgent, Please help]
content:
Education: B.Tech
Years of Experience: ~3.5
Prior Experience: SDE-1
Previous Comp: 25LPA CTC
Current Tech Stack: Java, Springboot

**Offer 1: Fivetran**

	•	Title/Level: Software Engineer II
	•	Location: Bangalore
	•	Salary: ₹30,00,000 (gross annual)
	•	Signing Bonus: nill
	•	Stock Bonus: 5320 RSUs (vesting over 4 years,  $12 per unit)
	•	Performance Bonus: nill
	•	Total Comp (Year 1): ₹30L + 13.5L stock bonus value(subject to market valuation)
	•	Benefits: Includes reimbursement, provident fund, and medical insurance
	•	Work Setup: Hybrid (1 day/week from office)
	•	Role: Working on monorepo with Core Java in the Connectors Team

**Offer 2: inMobi**

	•	Title/Level: SDE-II
	•	Location: Bangalore
	•	Salary: ₹38,00,000 (gross annual)
	•	Signing Bonus: Not specified
	•	Stock Bonus: 210 RSUs (vesting 25% first year, $60)
	•	Performance Bonus: Not specified
	•	Total Comp (Year 1): ₹38,00,000 + 3L stock bonus value
	•	Benefits: Comprehensive leave policy, customizable medical insurance, flexible working hours
	•	Work Setup: 5 days/week work from office
	•	Role: Working on Big Data in the Ads Team (a shift from my current tech stack: Java Spring Boot)


**My Confusion:**

I’m currently comfortable with Java and Spring Boot and have been working on distributed systems.

* Fivetran allows me to continue with Core Java, which aligns with my current expertise and interests. The hybrid work model is also appealing for better work-life balance.

* inMobi offers the opportunity to learn and work in Big Data, a new domain for me. It’s a significant shift from my current tech stack. While Big Data seems promising for the future, I’m unsure if making this switch now is the right move.

* Both saying they are planning to go to IPO in 1-2 years

Questions for the Community

	1.	Is shifting to Big Data worth it at this point in my career?
	2.	Does Big Data have a strong future in the tech industry?
	3.	Should I prioritize staying in my comfort zone (Java/Core Java) 
	    or take the risk of transitioning to a new domain?

I would appreciate any advice or insights based on your experiences with these technologies and career decisions.

title: URGENT HELP NEEDED | How to get a company to pay as close as possible to its budget
content:
Hi Everyone, 
I have 4 years of experience. Currently interviewing with multiple companies. My last compensation was 15 LPA Fixed. I have an offer for 31 LPA Fixed. A company that I am interviewing with (let's say, X) has a max budget of 45 LPA Fixed as per Glassdoor and Leetcode. I am inclined the most towards X. This company is having its interview process proceed rather quickly than the other companies in pipeline. 
My aim was to get counter offers of 35 LPA first, then a 40 LPA on this and present this offer to X to get it as close as possible to its budget. However, the pace at which X is going, it seems that it would wrap up its process before the others in pipeline (and hence would present its offer before the rest, if things go well). How do I navigate this situation?
Can I refuse to share my last compensation with X and just share my expectations depending on how well my interviews go? I have heard a few people go about like this. Folks having experience with negotiations, please share your views.

PS : Will share the companies and interview experiences with them later.

title: Paypal MTS 1
content:
1. What is the salary range for an MTS-1 position at PayPal?  
2. How is the work-life balance at PayPal?  
3. What are the opportunities for onsite assignments or transitioning to other departments?  
4. What is the current working mode—hybrid, in-office, or remote?  
5. What percentage hike can one typically expect in an offer from PayPal?
6. What is the annual increment cycle like, and what is the average percentage increase?
7. What is the current situation regarding layoffs or restructuring at PayPal?  


**Update (December 3rd): **
The recruiters have gone silent. Despite reaching out to all three points of contact who coordinated my interviews up to the bar raiser round, none of them answered my calls or responded to my emails. 
Is this how big organizations treat their candidates? 
With HR professionals recruited from prestigious institutes like IIMs and XLRI, wasn’t “valuing candidates and providing feedback” part of their training?

**Update (December 6th): **
Year end. Position on hold. Will get an update in January 2025.

title: Layoffs At Microsoft
content:
Microsoft has freezed hiring for some roles. Internal news is that layoffs are coming. 
Refrain from joining microsoft.

I cleared all 4 rounds and was waiting for the Offer but was rejected. I called the recruiter and was told about the hiring freeze. Internal news is that they are preparing for a layoff.

I just want to let people know if they have a similar or better offer from somwehere else then please prioritize that company. keep Microsoft at a lower priority.

title: Querries Regarding Samsung R&D Noida
content:
I am from a Tier 1 first gen IIT, and during our internship season, Samsung R&D Institute Noida (SRIN) visited our campus for the R&D Intern role. Here are the details:

* Stipend: ₹50,000 per month
* Duration: 2 months
* Location: SRI Noida

**Selection Process:**
1. Round 1: Written Technical Test
	* Format: Pen-and-paper test
	* Duration: 1 hour 30 minutes
	* 2 algorithmic questions (medium to hard difficulty). Only the algorithm needed to be written.
2. Round 2: Technical Interview
	* Duration: 30–45 minutes
	* Format: In-person interview
	* Questions:
		* 5–6 DSA problems (no code, only algorithm explanation).
		* Discussion on my projects and resume-related queries.
3. Round 3: HR Interview
	* Duration: 20–30 minutes
	* Format: In-person interview
	* General HR questions.

I was selected for the intern role.

**Additional Information Needed:**
I would like to know the following details about SRIN and the internship process:
* PPO conversion rate.
* PPO process details.
* PPO CTC and benefits.
* Timeline for receiving the intern offer letter.
* Typical intern experience and projects assigned.
* Perks and benefits during the internship and post-PPO (if applicable).
 Looking forward to insights into these aspects.

title: Seimens Healthineers vs STG Labs Offer
content:
Over the past two years, I have been employed in a healthcare-based mid-sized startup in Begalore. My compensation was fixed at 16 LPA, and I accumulated a total of four years of experience. Recently, I have received job offers for a Senior Software Engineer position from both Siemens Healthineers and Software Engineer from STG Labs.


**Siemens Senior Software Role Level 9:**
Compensation: 22 LPA, fully fixed


**STG Labs (Simphony Technology Group Labs):**
Compensation: 25 LPA, fully fixed
Role: Software Engineer

However, they have agreed to reclassify the role to Senior Engineer on the day of joining via email.
In terms of organization, Siemens Healthineers appears to be a more reputable company, and I believe they offer a better work-life balance. However, I am concerned about the potential legacy of their technology stack. STG Labs has a more advanced technology stack, but it is not as large as Siemens. There is a compensation difference as well any inputs will be appricaited which can help me out in choosing the offer.

Interview Exp for Agoda - https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6050889/Agoda-or-SSE-or-Bangkok

Doubts/concers :

2. I thnk Savings will be pretty much same or more in agoda , quality of life might also be better and good places to explore there but not sure about culture wlb and growth or brand value?

5. I'm inclined towords agoda but not sure if once i am in thailand, say after 2 years - will it be easy to switch to another company back to india( as recruiters see bangkok rather then say banglore or  they see an international number rather than an indian number and will straight away discard it?)
6. Does agoda do internal transfers(bangkok to india offices(gurgaon)

UPDATE :
Have accepted agoda and will reject paypal today.
main resson : agoda has job security with great culture and wlb and is kinda stable .( pay and savings will be kinda same considering hogh living expenses and low taxes which should cancel each other out) as compared to most product based companies or paypal(who had layoffs beginning of this year)

title: Google | Onsite | L5
content:
I had onsite recently with google and had 3 rounds as part of that . I cant share exact question, but can share leetcode question which mostly or completely resemble onsite interview:

First round :

https://leetcode.com/problems/regions-cut-by-slashes/

Second round :

https://leetcode.com/problems/earliest-second-to-mark-indices-ii/description/

Third round :

https://leetcode.com/problems/longest-increasing-subsequence-ii/description/

They expect to give most optimal answer , for example in third round . I did solved it by O(n2) but interviewer expected to solve it in O(nlong) time.
Surprisingly most interview was taken by non-asian people although I applied for asia role. Faced issue as some interviewer accent was tough to understand
Good luck to everyone

title: DE Shaw Interview Experience | India | Software Development Engineer (SMTS) | oct 2024
content:
Position: Software Development Engineer (SMTS)
Company: DE Shaw
Location: Hyderabad, India
Duration: October 2024
Experience: Python Developer with 4 years of experience

**Online Assessment**
Format: HackerRank
Content:
* Programming Questions: 2 questions based on Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA)
* Aptitude Questions: 5 brainteaser-style questions

**Round 1: Technical**
* Discussed previous projects and contributions.
* What algorithm helps in detecting snapshots in distributed systems? How does it maintain consistency?
* How did you manage the shift from a relational database to NoSQL, ensuring data consistency and handling challenges like schema evolution?
* How would you solve the issue of deadlock among five philosophers eating at a circular table, ensuring they can eat without starving?

**Round 2: Technical**
* Use grep to find lines in a log file that contain a timestamp within a specific range (e.g., between 10:00 and 11:00 AM) and have at least one error message in that line, without using any explicit range commands.
* What are the differences between Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Software-Defined Networking (SDN)? How do they change traditional network architecture?
* Compare multi-version concurrency control (MVCC) with traditional locking in databases. How do they affect transaction isolation?
* Implement the insertion operation for a red-black tree, ensuring all properties are maintained, including rotations and color fixes.

**Round 3: Managerial Discussion**

* Explain how CPython manages memory through reference counting and interacts with the garbage collector. What are the performance implications in multi-threaded applications?
* Describe the most challenging task you faced in the last five years.
* A financial trading application operates on version 2.31 of a custom protocol, how would you ensure reliable message delivery while maintaining low latency in the face of network fluctuations? How you would integrate TCP for critical transactions and leverage UDP for real-time market data updates, addressing issues like retransmission strategies, sequence number handling, and potential impacts on data consistency.
* If you have 12 apples, 24 oranges, and 36 bananas, what is the chance of having at least one orange and one banana left after removing all apples?

**Round 4: Techno-Managerial Discussion**
* What is implied volatility in options pricing, and why is it important in the Black-Scholes model?
* How does implied volatility reflect market sentiment, and what are its implications for risk management?
* If a stick is broken into three pieces by randomly choosing two points, what is the expected length of the middle piece?
* Explain the agile development process you follow in your current role.

title: Horrible experience with Walmart | SDE - 3
content:
Hi all had a very bad experience with walmart and just wanted to mention out here . We all know walmart is a low baller but nowdays walmart has crossed all levels of decency. 

I recently had my rounds with walmart , all rounds were very positvie , received good comments from interviewer after each round . The rounds went 1.5 weeks , then started the offer part . 

Hr contacted , she mentioned that max she could offer is 10-20% over my current base , later on she changed her mind and mentioned and she could only give 5% over my current base . 

I really wanted to move to a big org , since its been a while i was working with startups . I agreed as they were ready to give extra bonus to compensate less hike . This whole part took two weeks 

Now monday hr calls again she says she had talk with vps and engg mgr and they are not ready for my comp she shaid she could increase my bonus but my base hike would remain 0% ( yes you read it correct )  . I still agreed with thought will try to capture other oppurtunity otherwise i have received my hike on april and can work around with given base for next 1 yr considering fact walmart has stability and other perks . Though i was sad .

Again after 1 week , she called today morning saying the vp and mgr still didn't approve and they want to reduce further my base to more lower then my current base ( basically -ve hike ) , now she starts telling that my candidature and rounds feedback were poor , when i told her about the comments recieved by the interviewer she mentioned that they lie in front of candidate ( which i completely find bullshit ) and that they have given negative feedback for me . 

Afer this call i lost all my patience especially when i have an offer with 30% hike and over current base , i just gave her the callback and told to not call again if they are going to reduce my comp . 

Reason for mentiong here : I want the community to see how this company is depleting the standards with candidate hopes and time and wanted to share my secnario. I hope it could help you .

Its was for sde - iii postion which name is very big and but only compensation they can give for this position is peanuts .

title: Multiple Offers SDE-1 | 1.5 YOE | MindTickle | LambdaTest | IBM
content:
```
College - Tier 2, 2023 Passout - CSE branch
Experience - 1 year 5 months at startup, excluding internship.
Current Designation - **Software Engineer**
Current Compensation - 15 base + 1.5L year end bonus + 5000 units esops (vesting over 4 years 25% each with 1 year cliff)
First Year compensation at current company = 16.5L + 1250 units stock options

Current Offers (based on date of offers in ascending order):
1. **IBM - Backend Developer**
    Location - Kochi, Kerala
    Compensation - 16L base, 2L bonus (1L in first month and 1L in 13th month with 1 year clawback each)
    No stocks
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 16 + 1 = 17L

2. **LambdaTest - MTS [Software Engineer]**
    Location - Noida
    Compensation - 22L base = Total CTC 22L
    No joining bonus, No retention bonus, No stocks
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 22L

3. **MindTickle - SDE1**
    Location - Pune
    Compensation - 25L base + 1L JB (1 year clawback) + 10% retention bonus (2.5L) + 1000 units esops (vesting over 4 years 25% each with 1 year cliff)
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 28.5L (25 + 1 + 2.5) + 250 units of stock options
```
There were other offers as well but I think those were not adding significant value so skipped them (this also includes the ones that ghosted me at any stage). After the lambdatest offer, my current company did counter (and honestly, I was about to stay back). But, while negotiating I got the offer from MindTickle and moved on. The offer from MindTickle would have been a bit on lower side if I didn't had competing offers and if I was not on notice period.

I was looking for a good company since May-June 2024, got rejected at multiple companies and honestly the market seem to be in a bad phase as of now (not sure how others feel about this). Most of the good offers came to me not by applying rather the HR directly reached out over mail or Linkedin (I would say I was lucky here). But, parallely I was applying to my target companies one after another improving my resume after each rejection. And what helped me most at the interviews was my diverse profile that I got working at my current startup in multiple domains.

Rejected IBM due to low balled offer and location. Rejected Lambdatest as they were not ready to give ESOPs even though they are a startup (this is based on my own principle where I join a startup only when they give ESOPs, others might think differently).

I'm not sure of the value of ESOPs of MindTickle at this point. [I don't believe HRs on this front]. Still, since its  series E funded startup 1000 units looked good to me. **It would be of great help if someone can help me know the current value of these shares!!**

I'll post the interview experiences soon.

title: Offer Comparison: Coupang Staff SE vs LinkedIn Senior SE
content:
Hi I would like to decide b/w the two offer Coupang Staff vs LinkedIn Senior.

Present:
Company: Atlassian, P40 (SDE - 2)
Comp: ~ 84 L 
YOE: 10

Offer 1: 
Coupang Staff Software Engg L6 (For Taiwan Engg Team)
Base: 82L
Bonus: 8.2L (10% Not fixed)
Joining Bonus: 15L
Cash Lieu Bonus: 9.25L every quarter for 2 year
Stocks: 1.1 CR (Vesting: 10,10,40,40%)
Total : ~1.5 CR

Offer 2:
LinkedIn Senior Software Engg
Base: 65L
Bonus: 10% (6.5)
RSU: 40L per year 

Total: ~1.1 CR

Coupang: I gathers some info about the Coupang that there is not much techninal work and also the couterparts are the Korean so there is a language barrier as well that might leads to more time spent on the every task. 

LinkedIn: There I had discussion with the HM, work doesn't seem excited. Also the comp is low.

In case of Coupang in hand salary is very good and the diff in comp is also huge, now If I think about long term horizon say 3-4 years, I am not sure about the Coupang Share that will go double or something in next 5-6 year, so comp is going to remain same. While in case of LinkedIn RSU would be of Microsoft so there are chances of it going double in 5-6 years seeing the past trends. Also the perks are much better in case of LinkedIn. Compensation gap can be covered if MSFT done well. 

Things I am looking for 
* Some relavant work.
* WLB
* Recognition

Please help me decide on this and share any pointers about these offers and any downside/benefits to Coupang and  LinkedIn.

Thanks

title: Product Based to Publicis Sapient | Worth switching?? | Offer Comparison
content:
I'm currently in a **good product based company with good WLB**, have **joined it few months back**.

Gave Interview for **Publicis Sapient** parallely with other companies.
After clering the interview process at Publicis Sapient, **HR ghosted me for months**, and reached out few days back, extending an **offer which has around 65% hike from my current base (Base to Base comparison)** at the product based company.

Role offered at Publicis Sapient (Home location): **Senior Experience Engineer (Frontend SDE role)** 
Current Role at Product Based Company (Bangalore): **Software Engineer** 

YOE: **2 years 4 months (Full-time), 2 years 10 months (Including Internships)**

Current Compensation: **14 BASE + 10% BONUS + PF (~1.5 Lakhs) + 15k USD RSUs (vested over 3 years) = ~20-21LPA (First Year)**

Offer: **23.3 BASE + 5% BONUS (Pro-Rata basis, won't be applicable this year) + PF = 25.8 LPA**

Fun fact: **This role at Publicis Sapient is for 3.5+ YOE people, but I cleared the rounds, so is it gonna be risky in future after joining, considering my full time YOE is not even 3 years?**

Is it worth taking this risk of switching from a good product based company to a service based company whose reviews are not good online in this not so good job market ??

Would appreciate any insight, Thank you so much!!

Please let me know which company to choose, my priority is WLB which I think would be same in both the companies.

- PayPal stock is at the lower side as of now, which might have the potential to increase in future and SF stock is already at the higher end. 
- PayPal gives good refresher stocks which SF don't give(only based on performance).
- It's easier to promote in PayPal as the EM and MTS1 are at same level(T25), so only horizontal shift required not any actual promotion. While SF has a long queue of SMTS due to their downlevel trends in the interview process, therefore it would be diffucly to become LMTS at SF.

I am very confused which company to join? Please help

title: [Help Needed] Target Compensation during Job Switch | 1YOE | SDE1
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier 2
Btech Completed - July 2023
Years of Experience: 1 Year(FTE) + 10 months(Intern)
Current Experience: SDE 1(Frontend) at a small service based startup
Current Compensation - 10 L base + 60k PF + 50k Joining Bonus + 1.25 L Performance Bonus = 12.35 LPA

(Above compensation is exactly what I recieved last year, Performance Bonus was 2.15 L, but got less due to mid year joining)

WLB - Good
WFH - 4 days a month but negotiable
Holidays - 12 National Holidays + 15 Paid Leaves + 12 Sick Leaves
Learning Experience - Nill (We have flexibility to work on any part of product, so you can learn development end to end. But no defined technology structure, no mentorship, poor code quality, but constantly evolving team).
Higher Management - poor
Other Benefits - Nill
Office Culture - Will get a college vibe, friendly people, no politics but management is poor, will make you believe that everything wrong is your fault.
Job Security - good
Yearly Hike - 0% ( no hike this year due to market situation, they generally give 10-15%)


I'm planning for a switch in 5 months ( after taking yearly bonus, which can be approx 2L for me ).

How much compensation I should be aiming for in my next offer. Please help me so that I can target my expectations.

title: Journey of Multiple Offers | 1.2 YOE | Meesho | JIo Cinema | MindTickle | Dream 11
content:
```
	College - 2023 passout (Older IITs ), Non-circuital
	Experience - 1.2 years at Fintech Startup, Pune
	SDE 1
	Current Compensation - 17 base + 20% perf bonus + 1lac retention + 2.7 esops(vesting 5 years)
	Last year i got the best hike (33%) and perf bonus (17.75%) - Base went up from 13 to 17

	My journey has been really great so far now. I interned at Microsoft but did not get PPO.
	So, worked on my skills a lot and then had one offer in march from an edtech startup 
	(19 base + 10% perf + 1 jb) but continued at the current startup.

	Current Offers (In chronological order) - 
	1. Meesho SDE 1:
		Base - 22
		Esops - 14
		No perf bonus and no joining bonus.
		Location - Bangalore
	2. Jio Cinema SDE 1:
		Base - 23.65
		10 % perf bonus 
		JB- 2 Lacs
		No esops 
		CTC - 28 LPA
		Location - Bangalore
	3. MindTickle SDE 1:
		Base - 22.72
		10% Perf bonus 
		JB-1 lac
		Esops - 800 units (worth 10 lacs approx.)
		CTC - 36 (including esops)
		Location - Bangalore
	4. Dream11 SDE 1:
		Base - 28
		JB - 5.6 lacs(clawback 2 years)
		No perf bonus but annual hikes are very good 
		Esops - 12 lacs (strike price is 0 $), so total win for me
		Location - Mumbai
		
		Meesho updated offer after they got to know i am not going to join them because of lowball on esops  - 
		Base -22 as this is highest base for sde 1
		Esops - 18 
	    But team and manager looked shady although he was my college senior so decided to let go although i was               looking to move to bangalore, but dream11 looked better because of learning as well.
		
		Also almost everywhere i got calls directly from recruiters as i was not looking for change and was not practising rigorously for change, once i got offer from meesho i decided to try for multiple offers in bad market.
		Although i received rejections from Qualcomm (round 1 because of bad interviewer ),
		Apollo.io 2nd round(couldnt memory optimise 2nd dsa question, bad luck)
		Bar Raiser (2nd LLD round rejection, interviewer was an arrogant amazon guy didnot clarified the requirements and was adament to his solution then why are u having lld round)

		Overall, I am lucky and grateful to the community here at leetcode. I used to practice questions from interview experience and always wanted to put my multiple offers wala post was not knowing i will get so sooner.

	Will be contributing regularly to leetcode community and
	will post all the interview experiences in coming days.
	
	I am grateful to god for being so kind to me after that ppo setback.
```

title: Coinbase | SDE3 | Remote(India) | Sep' 24 [Offer]
content:
I am sharing my recent Coinbase interview experience for the Senior SDE (SDE3) position.


**Online Assessment:**
1. 1 coding question with 4 parts on codesignal in 90 mins. At least 3 parts need to be solved to qualify.
2.  Behavioural + logical reasoning assessment (20 mins each).

**Virtual Onsite (4 rounds):**
Round 1:
	* 1 coding question with multiple parts. I solved 4 parts with working code and passed all test cases.
	* 1 hour.
	* Communication is also judged.
	
Round 2:
	* 1 coding question with multiple parts. I solved 3 parts with working code and passed all test cases.
	* 1 hour.
	* Communication is also judged.
	
Round 3:
	* High-level system design of stock broker showing live prices of assests.
	* 1 hour.
	* Communication is also judged. 
	
Round 4:
	* HM round. Discussion on work experience. Discussion about the role in coinbase.
	* Bonus points for leadership experience. Communication is also judged. 
	* 1 hour.

Offer details: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/5836495/Coinbase-or-Senior-SDE-or-Remote-(India)
