title: Which company should I join ? Small US Retail Product Based vs Epam Systems vs T-Systems?
content:
YOE: 5+ Years
Education: B.Tech Tier 3
Current CTC: 25 LPA
Current Company: Small Service Based

I have 3 offers in hand.
1. Small US Retail product company:
* TC: 27 LPA (Fixed) + 3 LPA (Variable) = 30 LPA
* Tech: Azure tech stack
* Location: Delhi NCR
2. Epam Systems:
* TC: 34 LPA (Fixed) + 2 LPA (JB) = 36 LPA
* Tech: Azure/AWS tech stack depends on client
* Location: Delhi NCR
3. T- Systems:
* TC: 32 LPA (Fixed) = 32 LPA
* Tech: Azure tech stack + open stack
* Location: Pune

I have to join within Delhi NCR region, so T-Systems is going out of scope, although there tech stack is very interesting. Now within the Delhi NCR region I was inclined towards the small product based company as they are going to setup their data infrastructure from scratch, but this is not a tech product company. It's main business is retail and also not sure whether I will get some learning opportunity there or not. Coming to Epam, they are offering more and the difference is huge for me and tech will also be there but here the case is that it's kind of C2H role and the client will be some big product company for which I will have to clear the client rounds.

What should I choose?

Please give honest answers.

title: HubSpot New Grad Offer
content:
I recently got an offer from HubSpot as a new grad frontend dev

Base: 152k
Stocks: 20k/year for 3 years
Sign on: 5k

Currently working as a software dev at HPE for 1 year and a half. The team is amazing but HPE is known for not giving a great pay and I don’t have a high hope for a bump although I feel like I could use our upcoming demo to my advantage and tell them I have an offer for them to match it. My team has really senior engineers with 10-15+ years of exp, so it’s good that I have guidance but I feel like I won’t get a bump here.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise Salary:
Base: 120k
No stocks

Does it make sense to accept a new grad offer, if the pay parity is 50k? I did apply for senior roles at many places but not getting callbacks. Should I keep trying or a new grad offer is fine?

I’m a non-immigrant, so need to think about job security as well. In terms of growth, which one do you think is better?

As I consider the next steps, I’m curious about the different orgs and teams within HubSpot. which org has the best future in terms of growth? I’m also interested in learning more about the work-life balance across the orgs.

If someone joins in as a new grad software engineer, how long do you think it typically takes for a title bump?

Additionally, I’d appreciate any insights you guys can share about the bonus cycles—how they typically work, the general bonus percentage, and how title bumps are handled at HubSpot.

perf bonus - 10%
jb - 1L

title: Confluent | Databricks | Google | Microsoft
content:
Hey LeetCode community,

Sorry for using a clickbait title and posting this in the compensation section, but I wanted to share something I've been working on that I hope might be useful to others preparing for tech interviews.

## The Problem

Like many of you, I've spent countless hours preparing for coding interviews. One challenge I always faced was knowing which questions to focus on for specific companies. I found myself constantly digging through discussion threads, trying to piece together what questions were recently asked where.

## [The Solution](https://algorush.io/careerhub/company-search/)

To solve this problem for myself (and hopefully for others), I built a tool that:

1. Parses recent LeetCode discussions
2. Aggregates mentions of interview questions for different companies
3. Presents this data in an easy-to-use format

## How It Works

- Select a company you're interested in
- View a list of recently mentioned interview questions for that company
- See details like question frequency, difficulty, and relevant topics

## Additional Features

While working on this project, I realized there were other areas where we could all use some help. So I added a few more sections:

1. **[Practice Section](https://algorush.io/practice/)**: This includes a curated list of questions for:
   - Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA)
   - Low-Level Design (LLD)
   - Concurrency
   - High-Level Design (HLD)
   
   Each category has problems ranging from easy to hard, helping you build a well-rounded skill set.

2. **[Tech Bytes](https://algorush.io/blogs/techbytes/)**: A dedicated section to keep you updated with the latest in tech. It includes:
   - Recent developments in popular technologies
   - New tools and frameworks
   - Industry trends and news

   Staying informed about these can be really helpful during interviews and in your career generally.

## What I Learned

Building this was a great learning experience. Some challenges I faced:
- Dealing with unstructured text data from discussions
- Curating relevant and up-to-date content for the Tech Bytes section

## Limitations

It's important to note:
- This tool only aggregates publicly shared information
- The data might not be 100% accurate or representative
- It's meant to supplement your prep, not replace thorough studying

## Sharing & Seeking Feedback

You can visit https://algorush.io/careerhub/company-search/  to try it out I'm not here to promote anything - I genuinely want to give back to this community that has helped me so much.

I'd love to hear your thoughts:
- Is this something you find useful?
- What features would make it more helpful?
- Which section do you find most valuable?

Let's discuss in the comments.

## A Small Request

If you find this website useful, please consider upvoting this post. It would help more people in our community to discover and benefit from it. Your support means a lot and helps me know if I should continue improving and maintaining this website.

Happy coding, everyone!
![image](https://assets.leetcode.com/users/images/a26cc320-ca90-44f6-8953-3a16603c9ffd_1726124649.9149175.png)

title: Need Advice | Should join Goldman Sachs or Not
content:
Hello all,

I have 4+ years of experience and am currently working at FedEx ACC. It's been 9 months since I have joined FedEx ACC. I have recently received an offer from Goldman Sachs for an Associate role in Bangalore.

Current CTC: 22LPA (All fixed)
Goldman Sachs offered CTC: 29LPA (Base) + 4 - 5 Lakhs performance bonus
Goldman Sachs division: Corporate Treasury

FedEx ACC is my 3rd company(followed by TCS and UST Global) in my 4 YoE and my ultimate goal is to join one of the MAANG companies. I have been trying for MAANG companies from past 7-8 months and am not receiving any calls from them. I got a call from Goldman Sachs (GS) and I got selected into it. Is it a good move to join GS now? or stay in the current company for few more months and keep trying for MAANG?

Its not a great hike I'm getting at GS but I'm thinking like if I get into GS now, chances of getting into MAANG are higher. I am also worried like there wont be enough time for me to prepare for MAANG as the workload at GS is very high (as per Quora and other sites).

Please suggest what could be the best action to take now.
1. Stay at FedEx ACC, keep trying for MAANG (which could take months/years)
2. Join Goldman Sachs and keep trying. (GS will be my 4th company in 4.5 YoE)

title: Grab SSE || Expedia SDE-3 || M2P Fintech Evaluation & Advice needed
content:
Hi Folks, 

I've recently been offered SSE (G4) at grab & Expedia Groups (SDE-3). Below are some of the details

Years of Experience: 5+ YOE
Tenure at current company: Approx 3y

### Current Company: MNC (global financial technology platform)
```
Title: SDE-2
Base: 28.5 (Including PF)
Variable: 10% from the base (2.85L)
Stocks: $25k per year (Joining & 2 refreshers together)
Vesting cycle: 25% each year with 1 year cliff, then every quarter
```

### Grab Offer
```
Title: SSE (G4)
Base: 39L (Including PF)
Variable: 15% from the base (Approx 6)
Sign-On: 3
Stocks: $22,000 
Vesting cycle: 40%, 30%, 20%, 10%
```

### Expedia
```
Title: SDE-3 (Level L)
Base: 42 (Including PF)
Variable: N/A
Sign-on: 4 (3+1)
Stocks: $15,000
Vesting cycle: 40%, 30%, 20%, 10% (After first year, it's every quarter)
```


### M2P Fintech (Declined)
```
Base: 38L (Including PF)
ESOP's: 25L
Vesting cycle: 20%, 20%, 30%, 30%
```

Grab & Expedia benefits are pretty great & similar, **50k for wellness, 25k for OPD & Dental**. Grab offers more Accident Insurance & Term Insurance. but** Expedia offers kindof 12k extra **reimbursment every month comparing to grab**. I'll list all the benefits soon. 


### Query / Help Required
Friends, I need help in getting to know more about the **refreshers** from **expedia groups & grab.**
I'd like to know how much to expect as a part of refreshers every year. I'm considering for a long-term stay wherever I'm choosing, so refresher stocks are going to be a great deciding factor for me. 

PS: I will be posting all my interview experience. For the above 3 (& few are in prog) as well as my rejection experiences from Multiplier, Publicis Sapient, Zeta, etc. Along with **GHOSTING EXPERIENCE BY HACKEREARTH HR**. Stay Tuned.

title: CTC Breakdown: Base vs. Stocks Confusion?
content:
I've had this doubt for a long time about the CTC (Cost to Company) figure. Since I'm a student and not yet a working professional, I'm a bit unclear on this...😅

I understand that CTC is the total cost the company spends on you. But I was wondering how it's actually distributed in terms of salary and stocks.

For example, if the CTC is 60 lakhs with a base salary of 20 lakhs and 40 lakhs in stocks, equally vested over 4 years, how would the payout look?

Would it follow something like Option 1 or Option 2?

Option 1:
1st year: 20 L base + 10 L stocks = 30 LPA
2nd year: 20 L base + 10 L stocks = 30 LPA
3rd year: 20 L base + 10 L stocks = 30 LPA
4th year: 20 L base + 10 L stocks = 30 LPA

Option 2:
1st year: 20 L base + 10 L stocks = 30 LPA
2nd year: 20 L base + 10 L (1st year stocks) + 10 L (2nd year stocks) = 40 LPA
3rd year: 20 L base + 10 L (1st year stocks) + 10 L (2nd year stocks) + 10 L (3rd year stocks) = 50 LPA
4th year: 20 L base + 10 L (1st year stocks) + 10 L (2nd year stocks) + 10 L (3rd year stocks) + 10 L (4th year stocks) = 60 LPA

Which one of these scenarios is more accurate? Would appreciate any insights!

**Also, if it's Option 1, then why do companies boast about a CTC of 60 lakhs when in reality, you're getting nearly half of it—about 30 lakhs?**

title: URGENT | Compensation Improvement Advice Needed for Google
content:
I recently cleared my L3 interviews with ratings of H, SH, H, H. Recruiter responded with the following compensation package, stating that the Compensation Team advised this is the maximum they can offer. I also have a competing offer from DE Shaw with a total compensation (TC) of over ₹48 LPA (₹34 L base, ₹14 L bonus).

Here’s what was offered to me:

- Base: ₹23.5 L
- Stocks: 40,500 USD for 4 years (SEEMS LOW TO ME)
- Joining Bonus: ₹3 L
- Retirals: ₹1.9 L
- Performance Bonus: ₹3.5 L

This totals to a TC of ₹44.6 LPA, calculated as ₹23.5 L (base) + ₹3 L (joining bonus) + ₹3.5 L (performance bonus) + ₹1.9 L (retirals) + ₹12.7 L (stocks for 1 year).

However, I’ve seen posts on LeetCode suggesting that TC could reach ₹48-50 LPA. I urgently need better compensation for personal reasons, but the recruiter said they can't do much to improve the offer. Is there a way to request a special approval or make a case for better compensation?

Could someone advise on how to effectively push for a higher compensation? Is there any way to request a special approval or escalate this to get a more competitive offer? Any strategies or insights on how to negotiate this would be greatly appreciated.

title: Coinbase | IC3 | India
content:
* Education: B.E. in CS
* Years of Experience: 0
* Prior Experience: Interned at early to mid scale startups (total ~2years)
* Date of the Offer: Q2 2024
* Company: Coinbase
* Title/Level: IC3 (SDE1)
* Location: Remote, India
* Base: ₹ 31,00,000
* Stock bonus: ₹ 12,50,000 (Annual vested quarterly)
* Bonus: ₹ 1,34,000 (5% annual target bonus)
* Reimbursements: ₹ 3,26,000 (L&D, T&E, Connection, Care, ...)
* Total comp: ₹ 48,10,000
* Benefits: Extensive coverage of insurance, allowances and generous amount of leaves.
* Other details: Heard that signing bonus can be negotiated. Coinbase has transparent pay policy.  
* Background: State govt. college (tier 3), cf rating > 1900, comfortable in all parts of sdlc.

Interview: Process took about 4 months. Coding assesment(LC med-hard), psychiatric assesment, coding rounds(LC med-hard + production quality coding) and engineering manager round(In depth knowledge of jargons used in experience/cv). Finally the performance of all these round is reviewed by CEO/COO for final approval. 

Tip: Coding rounds are not generic dsa based rounds. You solve the given question, upon which you are given more extensions of the problems. Good coding standards are need to be kept in mind to easily decompose functionalities and extend the solution on new requirements. Be mindful of using jargons in managerial rounds as you will be taken in-depth based on what you say.

title: Google onsite rounds
content:
Hi everyone,

I had my Google screening round on June 25th. The following day, I received an update from the recruiter via LinkedIn, informing me that I had cleared the round and that he would call me. However, I waited until July 18nd for his call. During this time, I sent him multiple LinkedIn messages and emails without receiving any response. Eventually, I contacted candidate support with all the relevant details, and I received a call from the recruiter on the same day.

The recruiter mentioned that there was a delay because he needed approval to schedule the onsite rounds. (Can anyone confirm if this is a common situation ? I am not sure.) I asked for a tentative date for the onsite rounds, and he mentioned mid-August. The following day, he sent me preparation material for the onsite interview.

I waited until August 12th and sent him another LinkedIn message and email, but I still haven't received a response. While I am okay with the timing, I feel that there should be clearer communication regarding the details.

Could you please advise on what steps I should take next? Thank you in advance.

title: [Offer Evaluation] Microsoft vs ServiceNow
content:
Hi folks,

I've recently been giving interviews and cracked a couple of organizations after close rejections from multiple companies. I need your help in evaluating these offers.

YOE: 2+
Education: Tier-3 (CSE/IT)
Current Org: Product-Based Company (Internet Industry)
Current Total Comp: Approx 17 LPA
Reason for Switching: Minimal appraisal for two years, toxic environment due to a difficult manager.

Evaluation Criteria:

Job Stability > Future Growth Options (appraisal/promotions) > WLB > Pay > Other Benefits

**ServiceNow**
Position: Software Engineer (IC2)
Base Salary: INR 20L (**excluding** PF/Gratuity)
PF + Gratuity: INR 1,35,000
Bonus: INR 2L (10% of base)
Stocks: 29K USD RSU for 4 years, vested quarterly
Relocation: Standard relocation (INR 20,000 + Air Tickets + Hotel Stay for 15 days)
Joining Bonus: Nil
Total Comp (1st Year): ~INR 30LPA
Other Benefits: Standard ServiceNow benefits
Location: Hyderabad
Rounds of Negotiation Done: 0

**Microsoft**
Position: Software Engineer (IC2/L60)
Base Salary: INR 20L (including PF & Gratuity)
Bonus: 0-20% of base (On avg 10% as per old posts)
Stocks: 60K USD for 4 years
Relocation Bonus: 3,00,000 + 78,667 = INR 3,78,667
Joining Bonus: INR 2,00,000
Total Comp (1st Year): ~INR 40LPA (considering only 10% bonus)
Total Comp (2nd Year Onwards): ~INR 34.5LPA (considering only 10% bonus)
Other Benefits: Standard MS benefits
Location: Hyderabad
Rounds of Negotiation Done: 1 (Shared ServiceNow offer during the initial document submission and they came with this offer. Tried requesting an increase in base and to at least match ServiceNow (whose PF + gratuity is on top of base), but they emphasized the overall better package and brand value and didn't budge further.)

I am yet to present the Microsoft offer to ServiceNow and request a revision. Should I do that? Request your feedbacks.

Reference old post
* https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/5570495/servicenow-ic2-hyderabad/2560804

Benefits: Nothing special


I studied hard for months as I knew I was going to get laid off. I literally did nothing other than working during the office time then doing leetcode and system design on whatever time I got left with including weekends. Then I actually got laid off and immediately started interviewing. I made it to few onsites but got no offer other than this one so I accepted it. This entire year has been stressful for me, I feel the competition is high in the market right now for decent base salary. Anyways, remain motivated and keep working hard! 



Please upvote if this helps you :)

title: Need Urgent Suggestion on Current Job vs Walmart Offer
content:
I am currently working at a service based MNC remotely from home for the last 10 months. It's a decent company but very less brand value in comparison to Walmart. Previously I worked in a startup for 3+ years.

Walmart offered me 22 LPA Fixed + 9 LPA total variable [Work from Bangalore Office, Hybrid; Strictly Non negotiable on comp]
and Current Organization providing 22 LPA Fixed. [Work from Home]

So by accepting the offer I need to relocate to Bangalore. I'm confused as the base pay is same. Due to 30% tax deduction, my in-hand on total variable [9 LPA] would be around ~ 6 LPA only. And due to relocation my expenses would increase by atleast 4 LPA in Bangalore. So overall in-hand gain is ~ 2 LPA.

I want my next switch to be much higher as I plan to stay for longer time in a good company.

**I don't want to mess up this decision, so please please suggest your view on this.**

What would you have done?

title: Bharatpe Vs Gokwik GGN
content:
Hey Team,

I’m seeking some advice on choosing between two offers I’ve received for a Senior Developer role: BharatPe SDE3 and GoKwik SDE2.

Both companies have offered me a similar package of around ₹35 LPA. Based on my research, GoKwik seems to be doing really well right now, which makes it an attractive option (GoKwik Success Story).

However, BharatPe is a well-known brand with a strong name in the industry. They’ve also offered an additional ₹2-3 lakhs compared to GoKwik. I’ve also heard that the tech team at BharatPe is pretty laid-back.

GoKwik: Golang & Node.js
BharatPe: Java

P.S : I’ve worked with GoLang for more than 3 years in my previous roles.

I’m feeling a bit torn and would appreciate any insights or advice you might have on which company would be the better choice.

title: PayPayIndia vs Cashfree Payments | SDE2 | OFFER suggestion:
content:
**Current**: Company: Top Fintech YOE: 2.5 Current Compensation: ~ 32 (26+6) **Offers** In discussion, have asked for based on the current comp and previous compensation sources **PayPay India:** *Ask*: Base: 36-38 Variable: 0 Joining Bonus: 2-4 *Situation* They are heavily hiring nearly adding 70-80 engineers rn setting up their dev center in India. Not much is known about their WLB and other stuffs. I am sceptical that they can also layoff due to massive hiring in future.
Also, HR is looking for a lower compensation, I guess. **Cashfree Payment:** *Ask*: Had a discussion with them prior to interview where I mentioned this number again based on comp sources. Base: 36-38 Variable: 0 Joining Bonus: 2-4 *Now*: They are saying, they are low on budget and are now offering less in the current scenario. Base: 30 - 32 Variable: ~15% Joining Bonus: Maybe *Situation* Will it be a good idea to reconsider the ask in both the scenarios or should look for better opportunities in future?

title: Should I Switch from a Toxic Startup to a New Remote Opportunity?
content:
Hi everyone,
I don't know if this is the right place to discuss it here. Thing is I am not getting replies and serious need guidance so posting it here. 

I graduated in May 2024 and joined a startup in Hyderabad (Hyd Oniste) in June at compensation of 8 lpa. Unfortunately, the current work culture has turned out to be quite toxic, with no fixed working hours and a lot of micromanagement. Additionally, I'm struggling to adjust to life in Hyderabad.

Recently, I've received an offer from a new remote startup that started just 6 months ago. They’re willing to match my current offer. But i am bit worried about job security as it's quite new. 

Here’s a quick overview of my skills and situation:
- Strong in Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) with over 2500 problems solved
- 2000+ rating on LeetCode, 1500+ rating on Codeforces
- Proficient in ReactJS and Node.js
- Planning to target bigger MNCs or FAANG in the future

Given the toxic work environment and difficulty adjusting to Hyderabad, would it be a wise decision to join the remote startup?

I'd really appreciate your advice and insights. Thanks in advance!

title: Beware of PolicyBazaar | SDE-2
content:
I recently appeared for an interview process for an experienced role at PolicyBazaar. 
My details:-
Education: BTech Tier 3
Current Company: Service Based
CTC: (Single digit in lakhs)
YOE: 2yrs+

Here’s a summary of what happened:

**Round 1**: Technical interview with an experienced developer.
I answered all questions in 45 minutes.

**Round 2**: Technical interview with a team lead. 
I solved the problem and other questions in 25 minutes. The interviewer was very impressed with my knowledge.

**Round 3**: Interview with the CTO. 
The interview got rescheduled twice due to panel's unavailability, and when the interview finally happened, it started abruptly with no introduction. He asked detailed questions without considering my experience and role which they were hiring for, I somehow managed to answer. When it came to discussing my salary, I requested a 50-60% hike, which is lower than what they typically offer to the SDE-1s. The CTO abruptly ended the call, offering only a 20% hike.

Before the process began, I clearly stated that my current salary was low and I was only asking for a modest increase. The recruiter agreed to this. After the interview, the recruiter told me I was rejected due to unrealistic salary demands. I pointed out that this was not mentioned earlier. In reply she said 'the CTO’s decision is final, I cannot change his words'.

Having no choices left I told her that I am open to negotiations.
Eventually, I agreed to a 24% hike. She hurrily took all my docs for offer processing. 

She then accused me of forging documents and claimed my last year salary hike was untrue. I explained that I had received a 30% hike due to being a top performer and has also recieved several awards and recognition emails in the past year. Despite this, she was skeptical until I provided screenshots of my appraisal and manager feedback emails.

Then again she didn't spoke for few days but after multiple follow ups she accused me of editing my salary slips, so I shared my bank statement  with her, next day she called me and dicussed the salary breakup with me. After that she didn't spoke again. I tried reaching out through mails and calls, later she blocked me.

This experience has shown me how candidates can be exploited. It’s disappointing to see such unprofessional behavior from a company with a big brand name.

Please think twice before applying for such companies, even if you get selected, you'll be exploited badly.

content:
Interviewed with Apple India for software engineering role.

Had multiple 45 minutes interview rounds. Primarily interviewers were from US. 2 coding + 2 system design & 4-5 technical discussion.

Recieved offer today. Help me evaluate. I don't have any competing offers.

Tier - 1 uni grad. 7 YOE.

Currently Series A startup. For 3 years.
INR 81 LPA in-hand cash + (ESOP worth 356k USD)

Offer:
INR 39 LPA Base + (150k RSU USD) + 4 Lac joining + (gratuity + PF will be separate from this offer).

I am not sure of how to negotiate considering I don't have any competing offers. I am mostly thinking of asking for 50+ base atleast, but I don't think they'll take it.

My current job is good and I don't see any imminent danger to company finances either.

Microsoft:

title: Arista Networks | Bangalore | Software Engineer |  3 YOE
content:
Got the offer in Apr 2024
Background: IIT, 3 years 2021 grad
Previous TC:  21lpa (Fixed)
**Base** : 27 lacs
Retirals : 2.26 lacs
RSUs:  35K USD over 4 years
Sign On Bonus: 5 lacs
Anniversary Bonus : 4lacs 
**Total TC first year**: 45-46 lacs

I was able to get these numbers as I aggresively negotiated and had a counter offes, 
Arista's typical offer was ~ 32lpa for my YOE. 
Arista is a good company to work for (2 Days WFO+ Good WLB) and has good employee benefits such as ESPP.
They have started to pay really good in the past few years.

I declined the offer as I had other offers lined up. 
**Advise**: Always mention counter offers in negotiation, Never let your previous TC be a barrier for your offer.

title: Kotak Scam-mahindra bank
content:
I got a chance to appear for interviews for both Kotak 811 and KMB and seems like they are just taking everyone for granted. First they took 3 months to complete mere 3 rounds, because twice there interviewers couldn't appear on time to take the interview and then after taking every single document for offer discussion made me await for 1 month and then came with a lowball offer. 

On arguing that you have a bigger budget and as we discussed in the beginning regarding the offer, they refused to keep their word. Such unprofessional HR team you can't even think off. 

Kotak 811's so called "HEAD-HR", said that those high packages are for people coming from MNC's and as you are from a startup you shouldn't compare yourself to them.

I've spoken to 100s of HRs and dealt with them till now, but these people are egoistic on a different level.

title: Kotak Interview scam
content:
Guys, be careful while interviewing with Kotak. They conducted 4 rounds of interviews, after which they said I had cleared all rounds and asked for my compensation salary slips. However, I didn't receive any response for 2 months. When I called to inquire about the progress, HR said that the hiring manager couldn't approve my TC.
Even before starting the interview, HR asked for my current compensation.Such a waste of time and energy.

https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/4757887/People-beware-of-KOTAK-MAHINDRA

https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/4756819/Beware-of-HR-anurodh-gaud-in-KOTAK

Benefits: Standard (Internet, Fitness, Medical Insurance)
 
**Points worth mentioning:**
1. HR told that Avalara has the best work culture and will be offering promotions within 1.5 years if the performance is remarkable. 
2. Given option to chose either Pune(with relocation bonus) or remote

**Thoughts/Questions:**
1. Is the Base correct for the position offered? HR used the YOE as a primary point while negotiating. 
2. I would have asked 35L+ as base and would have started the negotiation. Totally messed up at negotiation.
3. Not having any other offers right now and cannot expect much promotion hike (not higher than 12%) from the current company. So planning to take it? Any suggestions.

**About the Interview and Recruiting porcess:**
1. Reached by HR through LinkedIn In-mail
2. Attended the Walk-In Interview in Bangalore
3. Continuous 2 hrs interview (Tech + HM) 
4. Breakfast, Lunch for the interview cadidates
5. Dinner with Team for the selected candidates

**EVENT UPDATE:** On July 29, there is a walk-in interview at Hyderabad. Check it out!

Note: I will add the interview experience soon

Breifly:

**Technical round:**
* Maximum width of Binary search tree
* Variation of LRU, followed by LFU
* Design question: based on API request and response fetching (asked because of the current work experience)
* Multithreading
* DBMS - Joins, Unique Key Vs Primary Key, Deduplication and some basic key questions
* SQL - Functions, triggers, Store procedures, DDL, DML
* Version control - basic
* Design question - Integrate AI features in any finance application (tried to cover some basic scenarios like chatBot, instruction panel)
* Project discussion on newly learnt feature from one project

**Hiring Manager:**
* Why leaving previous company?
* Why do you want to join here? know anything about the company?
* Agile methodology
* Can only work in Java?
* Newly learnt tech thing in last 6 months (discussed Change Feed Processor in Microsoft Cosmos)
* Newly learnt in the existing tech stack (discussed about reactive programming in Java - Flux and mono)
* Tell the self contribution in a project? delivered any API end-to-end?
* Do you think staging env should necessarily be stable like production in any Org? Why so?
* Again asked, why are you leaving the previous? told it is professional shift. Asked me to explain what it is?
* Compensation discussion

* **Bonus:** 0-20% of fixed
* **Joining /Sign-on/Relocation Bonuses:** 0(None)
* **Max comp:** Fixed(41.5 lacs) + Stocks(~18.8 lacs) + Bonus(8.30 lacs) = 68.6 lacs
* **Avg comp:** Fixed(41.5 lacs) + Stocks(~18.8 lacs) + Bonus(4.15 lacs at 10%) = 64.45 lacs
* **Benefits:** Standard Microsoft Benefits: Professional Development(2 lacs), Insurances, Child care, Free cab & shuttle, ESPP(at 5% discount)

**Interview Experience:**
* Interview took place in May.
* Initially was informed that 4 rounds would take place. 1 DSA + 1 LLD + 1 Sys Design + 1 HM.
* 1st round: Discussion on current experience(10 mins) + 1 DSA problem with 2 variants(20 mins) + Again Discussion on resume(30 mins)
* 1st round verdict: HR only informs with positive/negative. not the degree(strong/normal/lean). It was positive from HR. My verdict: Very strong.
* 2nd round: 1 DSA(20 mins). Interviewer hadn't prepared 2nd question. I had to dug a pit for myself by coming up with a variant and coded.
* 2nd round verdict: HR: positive. Mine: Strong. Interviewer wasn't very engaging, round was only DSA oriented, so I didn't enjoy and felt as good as other rounds.
* Was informed 1 hr after 2nd round that now only 1 more round will happen for me. It will(may) be a mix of everything(behavioural + system design + DSA). 3rd round was scheduled 30 mins from the moment this call happened.
* 3rd round: 2 folks were there. 1 my future manager(I now know because he is my actual manager too in offer letter). And 2nd guy was also very senior EM like. Started with a bit about myself. Then they explained a bit about team. Discussions on my resume and past experience. Few behavioural questions like my mentorship skills, my conduct with my manager, potentially resolving bandwidth issues in case of juggling between teams. 5 min quick HLD discussion on URL shortener. A bit discussion about the team at last. Interview lasted 1 hour.
* 3rd round verdict: This time recruiter itself called and informed round was positive. My verict: Very Strong.
* All this happened on Friday. Got the email for details on Monday.

**Post Interview Experience:**
* Same day was informed that I cleared. 
* 2 days later details were requested. 
* 1st discussion on expected comp happened 2 weeks after interview. 
* 1 week after that proposed offer was verbally communicated. Was trying for more stocks but recruiter didn't buzz as L62 was already an out of bands offer from them.
* Accepted 1 day after that.

Team: Azure Compute Core

Total (taking 10% bonus)= **73L (1st year)**  (76.8 if 20% bonus) and 72L (2nd year) +5% yearly increase in stocks
Stocks are back loaded (paid quarterly after vesting starts)

Benefits: Standard benefits like full coverage HealthInsurance, Gym, offfice Shuttle,  Free Mobile/Internet/Telework allowance, Pantry


**Project44 (Pre-IPO multi-national-startup) (SSE) :**
Base+PF: 50L+3L=53L
Variable 10% (+): 5L (yearly)
Stocks(ESOPS): 12000 units at 10$/unit over 4 years = 25L/year (strike price is 1.79$ so in case of pre-ipo resignation=20L/year)

Total (taking 10% bonus)= 58L(cash) +25L(esops)+3LJB=**86L**  First year and **85L** 2nd Year
Stocks are back loaded (vested monthly after vesting starts)

Benefits: Standard benefits like full coverage HealthInsurance, Gym, Uber creds,  Free Mobile/Internet/Telework allowance, Pantry, Taxsaving stuff in flexi

Note: all offers are negotiated values. Any suggestions/advice to help deciding, pre-joining is welcome.

title: Keploy | SDE intern | Offer
content:
They take two online rounds of interview for SDE intern role. The first would be coding round with few questions about the fundamentals of go and technologies used in their company like ebpf. In my case, I was asked only a single leetcode question: https://leetcode.com/problems/alien-dictionary/. 

The second round was more like technical, in which they go through your resume and ask about your experience, achievements and projects. They generally give you an offer at the end of this round. 

They offer 4 months or 6 months internship with a pay of Rs. 25000 per month for remote. Apart from this they don't offer any additional benefits. You have to work with your own laptop.

title: Seeking Advice: Switching Jobs with Third-Party Payroll Experience
content:
Seeking Advice: Switching Jobs with Third-Party Payroll Experience
Hello everyone,

I hope you're all doing well. I am currently working at Flipkart, but my employment is through a third-party payroll company. This means my salary and employment records are under the third-party company rather than Flipkart itself.

I am considering a job switch and am a bit concerned about how this might affect my prospects. Specifically, I am wondering:

**Impact on Job Applications:** Will potential employers view my third-party payroll status differently than direct employment with Flipkart?
**Verification Processes:** How might this arrangement affect background checks and employment verification processes during the hiring process?
**Resume Presentation**: Should I highlight my role and responsibilities at Flipkart prominently on my resume, or should I also emphasize the third-party payroll company?
**Salary Negotiations:** Will this affect my salary negotiations or the way new employers assess my current compensation?
I would greatly appreciate any insights, experiences, or advice you might have on navigating job switches with a third-party payroll background. Thank you in advance for your help!

content:
YOE: 7.5 yrs
Position: SDE-II

Location: Bengaluru

RSU: ~30LPA

Amazon Experience:
Have been with Amazon for the last 2.5 yrs. The org culture is terrible (Eg: working or creating code reviews during late hours / working over weekends are glorified and appreciated during stand-ups.) Manager does not have any backbone and cannot push back on anything. Quality of work is below par. No opportunity for growth.

Offers:

1. PhonePe
Position: Software Engineer (Only 2 engineering levels in PhonePe: Software Engineer & Architect)
Base: ~60LPA
Joining Bonus (1st Month): ~5 LPA
Retention Bonus (13th Month): ~5 LPA
ESOPs (Paper Money): 90 Lakhs over 4 years (25% each year)
Location: Bengaluru

2. Oracle (Database Cloud Ops Platform, Non-OCI)
Position: Principal Engineer (IC4)
Base: ~56 LPA
RSUs: ~20 LPA
Location: Bengaluru

Personally, I want to venture into the FinTech space and learn about the Payments domain. Hence, I am inclined towards PhonePe. From the designation perspective, I am thinking whether the "Principal Engineer @ Oracle" tag will help me more than "Software Engineer @ PhonePe" tag? Also, as PhonePe stocks is currently Paper Money, it is of no monetary value. Can someone help me decide what should I choose based on WLB, Quality of Work, Learning Opportunities, Designation importance (if any) ?

title: Expected Compensation for L61 at Microsoft
content:
I have given the interview for L61 role at Microsoft in Azure team. Even before the interview process I had told the recruiter that I will be getting promoted in Q3 and I will also consider that for salary. He agrees and proceed with the interview.

Now I have received the mail from another recruiter (post interviews, all interviews went sexy) to submit documents regarding my current salary and other offers I have.
When I told her that I will be promoting in Q3 and my salary will increase, even before knowing my current salary and increased salary, she told me that it will be on me whether I have to continue and getting promotion and join them.

Currently my base is 18.5 Lakh, 2 Lakh bonus and stocks worth 7.5 lacks. I had also mentioned in the mail that after promotion I will be getting 36-40 Lakh base and TC of around 50-55 (which is the starting range for SDE-2 in Amazon).

What offer can I expect?
I am also in negotiation phase of other company (startup) where I might get ( 36 base, 4 bonus, 1.05 relocation, 1.25 other benefits like insurance and all and ESOP worth 2 Lakh in first year).
In this startup I will also be getting bonus in next two year also and more ESOP's in upcoming year.
Should I tell this to MSFT, I am thinking if I tell this startup offer letter they will just give a little bit hike over this and will be less than Amazon SDE-2 salary or should wait for there initial offer letter or should negotiate just with my expected salary (Amazon SDE-2 salary)

P.S- I don't want to stay with Amazon as I don't like working with my manager and moreover I don't want to go again in the same process of finding time for interviewes during working days.
Your suggestion will be really helpful.

TC- 28 LPA
YOE- 1 year 11 month as SDE-1 (had done 6 month internship in same team just before starting as full time)

title: Microsoft | L62 | India
content:
Education: Btech, IT
Years of Experience: 4.5
Prior Experience: SDE2 at a well known company, 60LPA(but had to leave the firm, so no job right now)
Date of the Offer: May 2024
Company: Microsoft
Title/Level: SDE2, L62
Location: India
Salary: 40LPA
Signing Bonus: 3 lakhs
Relocation Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: $60k vested equally over 4 years
Bonus: 0-20% of base i.e 0 to 8 lpa
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 59LPA for first year, 56LPA from subsequent years. (Assuming an average of 50% i.e 4 lakhs bonus every year).
Benefits: Standard Microsoft benefits.
Other details: I previously had a high salary before(60LPA), and the stock component was > $100K. However, I was still offered just 60k$ worth of stocks by Microsoft. Moreover, they always give around 50% of the varialble pay if you meet expectations. I was not provided with any relocation bonus also. 
I had a long discussion with the recruiter but she was not ready to listen. I have seen L61 offers with a higher stock comonent than this. Its upsetting to see L62 offers having stocks as high as 120k-130k USD but only 60k$ USD for me, which is less than a few L61 offers as well. 
I am currently awaiting another offer right now, and am quite certain that they would come up with good numbers. In this case, should I tell the new offer to the Microsoft recruiter to renegotiate after having accepted the offer?
NOTE - I am ready to walk away from the Microsoft offer in the worst case. I already have a good brand name on my resume, so even though Microsoft would be a good to have, its not my first priority. 
Thanks.

title: Google | L5 | Hyderabad, India
content:
Google, India L5 compensation details:
Total years of experience : 8
Base: 60.5L
Joining Bonus: 10L
Annual Bonus: 9L
Stocks: $219k USD for period of 4 years (front loading of 38% for first year)

First year TC: 1.49 cr

There were 3 coding rounds, 1 system design round, 1 behavioural and then team fitment calls
Overall interview process took around 2 months including team matching rounds. It took 2 months mostly due to me delaying it for preparation otherwise the HR did excellent job at interview scheduling and follow up

I didn't have any competing offers, so negatiotion was pretty straight forward and not a lot of to and fro happened

Edit 1
Added this section to answer questions asked in the comments section

1. My current employer, and CTC: I work an e-commerce company and have a CTC of 80 lpa approx including ESOPs [Not mentioning the exact company as i haven't made this post anonymous]
2. Interview experience: All coding rounds were of 45 mins each. I was asked 1 question per round, these questions weren't directly found on leetocde, but i felt the questions were similar to leetcode hard. Design round was primary focused on high level design, and sticking to the format mentioned in Alex Xu book helped
3. Prepartion strategy: I completed top interview 150 card on leetcode to cover the usual patterns of questions, and range of topics. For design I read Alex Xu's "System Design Interview" book, and watched videos of Narendra L on youtube
4. Time between each rounds: I had all my coding round in a span of week's time, then i almost took one month to prepare for design, and behavior round and then had them both in one week's time. My team matching took another week to be closed

title: Am I lowballed by my new product company? service to product, not feeling good.
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm reaching out for some advice on a career decision I made.

Previously, I had a decent remote position with a service company in Gurugram, earning 23 LPA with 10 years of experience in the finance sector. Seeking better security, I jumped to a product startup entering the Indian market for a 34 LPA offer (29 fixed + 5 variable, specific to engineers).

The new company is in Hyderabad, and I was surprised by the high cost of living. Forget 2-3 BHK flats under 1 crore, builders just laugh! Rents are high too.

Starting in April, my salary dropped by 35k per month compared to the initial 3 months.

Now, I'm questioning my decision. While I had a 32 LPA offer from a service company in Gurugram, the product company's policies are concerning. They make frequent changes, and my manager openly discusses replacing European contractors with cheaper Indian hires.

The supposed salary increase barely covers the increased expenses in Hyderabad. Additionally, office politics seem rampant, with other teams creating drama despite my team being okay.

Honestly, with the pay cut and considering the same-city service company offer with better policies, I feel like I might've made a mistake.

What are your thoughts? Should I explore other options or try negotiating within the company?

title: Zepto vs Phonepe (Offer evaluation)
content:
Hi Leetcode community

Please help me out in deciding what’s the best option here. My notice period has ended and I am really having a hard time in deciding what to choose next.

My current details
Years of experience: 5
Previous TC - 29L base + 10% bonus + yearly stock refreshers(10-15k USD) with 3 year vesting cycles

I have never worked in a fast paced environment so I have a big fear of missing out on that kind of experience in my career once.  Have had very limited learnings in all these big companies which have a lot of bureaucracy and bad maintenance work and some of it is my fault too as I was lazy to not upskill myself enough. Zepto is guaranteed to have new work and a fast paced learning environment. PhonePe has matured now so I am not sure how much of learning will I get there. Though, PhonePe should still give a much better experience than all the companies I have worked for so far in my career. I was earlier leaning more towards PhonePe but can't decide anymore.

I do value learning more at this point as I feel I am a bad engineer as I don’t have a lot of hands-on on latest tech.

Zepto
Base: 42L
ESOPs: 20L for 4 years
Joining Bonus: 3L
Team : Given free choice to opt(multiple teams on their way to build microservices from scratch for the exisiting monolith)

PhonePe
Base: 42L
ESOPs: 36L for 4 years
Joining Bonus: 5L
Team : Merchant Onboarding

Please give me suggestions. I just can't make right decisions at all.

title: Microsoft Hyderabad
content:
Hi everyone,

I recently interviewed with Microsoft in the second week of May 2024 and recently received a verbal confirmation of an offer. The details shared verbally are as follows, and I am currently waiting for the formal offer letter.

*Details*:

**Years of Experience**: 7 years this July (currently 6.8 years)
**Current Company**: Tier 2 Startup in India
**Current Compensation**: ₹55 lakhs (Fixed) + ₹12 lakhs (ESOPS)
**Current Position:** Senior Software Engineer

*Offer Details*:
**Location**: Hyderabad
**Position**: Unknown
**Team**: Unknown
**Base Salary**: ₹42.5 lakhs
**Joining Bonus**: ₹12 lakhs (₹6 lakhs in the first year + ₹6 lakhs in the second year)
**RSU**: $100k vested over 4 years (approximately ₹20.5 lakhs per annum at the current share value)
**Relocation**: Some amount mentioned but not specified
**Performance Bonus**: Not mentioned
**Benefits: Microsoft** Benefits
**Overall Compensation**: ₹69 lakhs

Questions and Concerns:
1. I feel I was low-balled.
2. There is not much of a hike, and there is a significant depreciation in the base salary.
3. How should I negotiate, and what would be the right value considering my years of experience?
4. Should I ask for an increase in RSUs? I have seen many posts from 2022, 23 and recently where candidates with 5 years of experience were getting $120k-$140k in RSUs and better overall compensation.
5. How should I negotiate effectively? Can I tell the recruiter that I am seeing candidates getting better offers on LeetCode and from friends at Microsoft?
6. Is performance bonus is standard 20% for microsoft employees or the option itself is given to few candidates

Would like to seek some help on the above questions.

P.S: I mentioned to the recruiter that the offer doesn't seem great and he said he will check on what he could do. Will update once i have the new numbers

title: Which one is better ? Amazon or Uber
content:
Hi Leetcode community,
I have offers from Amazon and Uber. Given the below scenario, can you help me in choosing one of them?


| Ceriteria  | Amazon | Uber |
| -------- | ------- | ------  |
| Role    |  SDE-2    |  SDE-2  |   
| Compensation(including all components)  |   ~65L per annum  | ~65L per annum   |
| Team tech stack |  Java and others  | Java and others   |
| Team culture    |  Have talked with team members it looks good unlike Amazon's toxic work culture. As per one of the team members, they usually work for ~7-8hr per day   | Same case here(~7-8hr per day)  |
| Company culture   | As you know    | As you know  |
| Stock growth    |  I expect good growth if not atlease stable value | Not sure as it is highly volitile  |
| Location   | Bangalore   |  Bangalore |
| Onsite oppurtunity | Onsite is available after one year of experience  | Onsite is available but it needs two years of experience | 

Let me know your thoughts on which team to join based on your own experience without any second hand info. 

PS: I have 4 YOE, graduated from Tier 1 college.

title: Meta Vs Chainlink Offer
content:
I was lucky to get 2 similar offers from Meta and chainlinks (backend engineer) but I am not sure which one will pay off financially later
Meta rewards its employees properly but at the cost of working so hard. i need some signals on how chainlink compensates its employees. i already know the meta ones.

Chainlink (10B $ market cap) looks more interesting to me with a good potential in Web3. Meta not much, thier VR space looks gonna end b2b. in the AI , I think there are other leaders. 

 Meta concerns:
 toxicity and performance review being a function of peer performance. so it does not matter how hard you work. it matters how relative you are to your peers. some people have commitments to tier families but some are singles.

during the behavioural interview, the guy gave me a strong red signal saying he used to work for 10 years on average 12 hours a day. you need to put a lot and a lot of work to be good in meta.

Meta TC: \xA3230K with 3 days to the office
Chainlink TC: \xA3260K TC and fully remote

title: [offer Evaluation] Intuit vs Microsoft vs Walmart
content:
Hi folks, 

Have recently been giving interviews and cracked couple of organisations, here's are some offer that i got, Need your help in eveluating these.

YOE - ~8
Current Org - well known indian startup (Flipkart, Razorpay types)
Current comp -  60LPA (base) + 6LPA (variable) + ~1.1cr ESOPs vested for 4 years
Reason for switching - Peanut appraisal since two years, toxic enviroment and current manager is piece of shit.


**Evalutaion Criteria**
future growth options > Learning = Pay > WLB = Remote > other benefits

--------- **Intuit**
**Position** - SSE
**Base** - 44LPA
**Bonus** - 15% of base
**Stocks** - 50K USD RSU for 4 years
**Joining Bonus** - 3L
**Retention Bonus** - Nil
**Other benefits** - Standard intuit benefits
**Location** - bangalore
**Round of Negotiation done** - 0


------- **Walmart**
**Position**- SSE
**Base** - 38LPA
**Bonus** - 20% of base = 7.6L
**Stocks** - 25% of base per year = 9,50,000/year
**Joining Bonus** - Nil
**Retention Bonus** - Nil
**Other benefits** - Standard walmart benefits
**location** - bangalore
**Round of Negotiation done** - 0


------- **Microsoft**
**Position**- SSE (L62)
**Base** - 46LPA
**Bonus** - 0-30% of base
**Stocks** - 80K USD for 4 years
**Joining Bonus** - Nil
**Retention Bonus** - Nil
**Other benefits** - Standard MS benefits
**location** - bangalore (potential WFH)
**Round of Negotiation done** - 0


**Other Companies in pipeline**
[Apollo.io(in 4th round), Rippling(3rd round), Thoughtspot(2 rounds)]

content:

--

Performance Bonus: 10%(2.8 LPA)
Stocks: 13.9 Lac for 4 years, almost 3.4 lakhs per year

--

Felt both were pretty lowball though.

title: 3L to 32L | Journey from Tier 4 to TCS to Oracle, ServiceNow, AlphaSense, Rakuten, Lowe's offers
content:
Recently I've been getting a lot of DMs after my switch. Decided to share my journey to help out this amazing community in these tough times ❤️

**Fun college days with no internships nor coding**
I was really into sports so used to be on the field all the time so these things never came across my mind until after I graduated. Best takeaway was a computer science degree.

**Debut at a Service Based Company**
Literally zero companies came to our campus. Somehow got a job at TCS and was really happy. Still unaware about leetcode. 

**Decided to prepare for a top product based company**
Started with Leetcode. Tried easy questions. Failed. Learnt all the data structures. Fundamental algos. Solved easy questions. Tried medium questions. Failed. Implemented all the data structures and algorithms learnt. Tried medium questions. Failed. Solved 3 and 4 point questions from virtual contests. Slowly progressing. Still after one year of this I couldn't solve a given medium question. Back to drawing board.

**Change of approach and focus**
I was doing a full time job also. I needed more hours everyday to prepare. Stopped everything. Focused on health and diet. Dropped sugar completely. Started leetcode again with a fresh mindset and energy. Got myself a digital pen that helped a ton. Every question I fail I'd retry in 3 weeks. Always kept a timer and always talked as if I was at an interview to get used to the pressure. Never viewed the topic before attempting a question. I want to be able to figure out if this is a Dp question or greedy. Followed this random guy Elite Code on yt he has these raw videos of him approaching unseen problems. Then learnt everything about backend engineering and honestly fell in love with it.    

**Applying, networking and linkedin suspension**
Everyday I'd connect with people from target companies. Was getting referrals but wasn't getting shortlisted. Possibly due to being from a no name college and service based company. Connected and requested more than a thousand people in hope. Instead I got suspension from linkedin because of spammy activity lol. This was like when the market was at it's worst.

**Change of approach and finally the breakthrough**
Somehow got the account back and changed my approach. Started to engage with people's posts with genuine curiosity and love for software engineering. Small things like commenting would help with visibility and good networks. Leveraged this, with trying to get names of the recruiter or HM and contact them. Even request follow up to referrer at  times. Eventually got interview opportunities with many good product companies and was able to pass all. Was able to get offers upto 32L. Yoe is 2+. It came to a point where I had to decline interviews from good companies, as I was already content.

**Overall essentials IMO 💯**
- Maintain a solid graph in your leetcode profile.
- Don't over or under-prepare. If you can solve 5 pointer LC questions and some of the 6 pointers, go start applying. That's a whole another game in itself too.
- Network as much as possible. That's the only way.
- See what people from these companies are posting about on linkedin. Engage. These insights will be your differentiators when the interviewer asks "do you have any questions for me"
- There are too many things to cover but keeping it short here.

Hope it helps. 

Edit: those who're connecting via linkedin rest assured I will get back to you sooner or later

title: Swiggy Associate SDE (aSDE) | Interview & Compensation
content:
Swiggy is recently in hiring spree for Associate SDE. Got an offer for the same.

**Interview Process**
- Online Assessment - Basic Programming Questions, Development assignment. Enough time was given,
- Interview R1 - Machine coding round, had to develop a component in React. Aced it! Completed bonus questions too.
- Interview R2 - Problem Solving round, 2-3 LC Medium questions. Solved all.
- Interview R3 - Hiring Manager Round. Discussion on experience, work-style preference, familiarity with remote culture.

Received mail after 2 weeks that I am selected, and that they will roll out the offer letter soon.

** Received offer letter, shocked! **

**Compensation Details**

CTC - 8 LPA
Base - 3.2 LPA
HRA - 1.2 LPA
Special Allowance - 3.3 LPA

Should I take it?

title: Salesforce LMTS offer
content:
Education: Computer Science Tier 1 College (NonIIT)
Years of Experience: 10.5 Years
Prior Experience: Tier 2 Company NonFaang

Date of the Offer: March 2024
Company: Salesforce
Title/Level: LMTS
Location: Hyderabad
Salary: 80 Lac Base, 15% Variable
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: 180K USD / 4 years
Bonus: 0
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 80 lac + 12 lac + 38 lac = 1.3 cr
Benefits: Salesforce benefits
Other details: No competing offers and laid off from the company hence my previous TC was 0

I got rejected from
Amazon (rejected in first round) - ghosted by recruiter
Microsoft (no update after 1 month) - ghosted by recruiter
Google (4th round) -> Great experience so far even i rejected!! So much i learned from all rounds. Happy Here
Coupang (6th round i got rejected after 1 month of interview loop :() -> heartbroken
Wayfair (1st round) 
ServiceNow (1st round) 0> Left interview in 20 mins as interviewer was not listening. 
Atlassian (3rd round) -> all went pretty good but was ghosted by recruiter (2nd try in 4 months)
Coinbase (1st round)


So i want to tell you guys one thing don't lose hope and keep on persisting inspite things don't go your way. At one point i thought this is an infinite and never ending loop. I was expecting coupang offer for sure but did not get and was also positive on Microsoft. Not sure on Salesforce but got the offer. Hence there is a hope for everyone. Just keep doing & take a break if you feel fatigued. The road is very long but you are not alone.

Outer image is this dude earns so & so. But actual reality is
1. Interview pressure. (just 30 mins before you feel numb due to expectation you set on yourself)
2. Handle things when you completely don't know the answer. How to pray that your current interview just finishes. Your brain has limits
3. You forget lot of things which you are capable of without interview pressure.
4. Sometime IDE not allowed hence typing manually on platform is overkill. Don't know what interviewer expecting.
5. Google expect O(N) not O(N + N) which essentially almost same but they reject folks based on double loop. So sick.
6. Gave couple of interview when my leg is paining and i was under fever. The show has to go on.

At the end i feel employer should have mercy and use common sense judging candidates. There is so much things going in preparation. Judging is easiest job. Performing under immense judgement is toughest job.

My family was with me in very tough times and they sacrificed a lot for me. I am not gonna forget and they are my first priority. Even as a failed person they accepted me and there is no difference pre and post this offer. I realized i had everything even without job. Family >>>>> Career

Interview exp : https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/5114952/Salesforce-LMTS-interview-experience

title: Reverse Integer LeetCode Problem Solution in Python
content:
Introduction:
Hello everyone! In this post, I'll be sharing my solution to the "Reverse Integer" problem on LeetCode using Python. This problem involves reversing the digits of a given integer.

Problem Description:
Given a 32-bit signed integer, reverse the digits of the integer.

Example:
Input: 123
Output: 321

Solution:
python
def reverse_integer(x):
    sign = -1 if x < 0 else 1
    x = abs(x)
    reverse = 0
    while x != 0:
        digit = x % 10
        reverse = reverse * 10 + digit
        x = x // 10
    reverse = reverse * sign
    if reverse < -231 or reverse > 231 - 1:
        return 0
    return reverse


Explanation:
1. We determine the sign of the input integer and store it.
2. We take the absolute value of the integer to work with positive numbers.
3. We iterate through each digit of the integer using a while loop.
4. For each digit, we extract it using modulo 10 and add it to the reverse after multiplying the reverse by 10 to shift digits left.
5. We update the integer by removing the last digit.
6. We multiply the reverse by the stored sign to restore the original sign of the integer.
7. We check if the reversed integer overflows, and if it does, we return 0.
8. Otherwise, we return the reversed integer.

Complexity Analysis:
- Time complexity: O(log(x)) where x is the input integer
- Space complexity: O(1)

title: Self Intro
content:
As a software engineer, I specialize in designing and developing robust and efficient software solutions to address complex problems. With a strong foundation in computer science principles and a passion for innovation, I thrive on creating software that not only meets the functional requirements but also adheres to high standards of quality, scalability, and maintainability.

My experience spans various domains, including web development, mobile applications, machine learning, and data analysis. I am proficient in multiple programming languages, such as Java, Python, JavaScript, and more, and I continuously stay updated with emerging technologies and industry best practices to deliver cutting-edge solutions.

I enjoy collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, leveraging agile methodologies to drive projects forward and achieve tangible results. Whether it's architecting scalable systems, optimizing algorithms for performance, or troubleshooting complex issues, I approach every challenge with dedication, creativity, and a focus on delivering value to end-users.

Beyond technical expertise, I also value clear communication, teamwork, and continuous learning. By combining technical excellence with effective collaboration and a growth mindset, I aim to contribute positively to projects and make a meaningful impact in the field of software engineering.

title: community rulr
content: Making a downvote will cost the voter 1 reputation." is bad idea. There will be flood of jokes, trolls, self promotions, irrelevant comments and discussions. The voting is there to keep that in the check. Reporting such post would not help as there is time period between moderator would act upon for e.g. someone posted link to malicious site.\n\nAlso, need further clarification on "If we discover the malicious voting behavior, we may silently remove the votes and have the LeetCode accounts deactivated without prior warning.". What is malacious voting behaviour - if I upvoted 20 posts in a day - I spent entire day on LeetCode solving different problems and unknowingly up voted as many as 20, because they were helpful, will it be considered as malicious? This should not be vague - otherwise no one use voting.

title: HCl tech bee program

title: NewRelic India Hiring | SCAM !!! | Avoid
content:
Hello Community,

I will share my bad experience while interviewing with **NewRelic**.
They had a hiring drive in last week of march where they invited people post resume screening and a mettl test(This itself was mixup of 2 MED-HARD questions along with basic CS fundamentals which are often seen in campus screening in India to be solved in 60 mins). **Recruiter(Contractor Camsdata technologies) already had discussed about the current ctc and expected ctc and mentioned that there is no upper cap for good candidates**.
Onsite interviews consisted of two techincal rounds[1 techno-managerial round].
To a bit surprise, the HM only focussed on behavioral aspects for the whole time and other person asked both DSA and Design(HLD) in one round.

After three days, they intimated that feedback is positive and asked for expected numbers. Here as well they made clear that there is budget and soon offer will be released. Next day they asked for the salary slips, and **no further update for next two weeks. After multiple followups they let me know that expected CTC is high and they can offer max upto a number which is less than even my current CTC. I rightway declined that.**

My Observation : They have recently started the hiring in India post their layoffs in US and here they are just assesing the market and salary ranges. They should have clearly mentioned that budget at the first touchpoint itself and not after taking salary slips of other company.

If your salary is in FAANG range, you may want to avoid this.
**Please share if anyone faced similar situation.**
Posting here in the comp section as this section has max visibility.

title: Help me Choose between 2 different fields for SDE-2 (data role vs backend dev)
content:
Hello Everyone , I have 2 offers from 2 mid size startups with 200 engineering workforce , both offering SDE-2 Roles , but both offering very different work . 

Company A is offering role related to data engineer ,even though its a officially a full stack SDE-2  , so this involves writing sql queries and data modelling , no data piplines need to be  built , no discussion on the underlying architecture since its already built . They are paying around 15% more than company B .This requires me to relocate to a new location .

Company B is offering role related to a backend dev , working on API/micro-services at scale.This job is fully remote .

About my experience I have worked as a backend dev similiar work to what Company B is offering for past 2 years at a well known company as an SDE-1. Total YOE : 2 years .

My dilemma : Does it make sense to shift to a data engineer sort of role to increase the breadth in my technical skills or to take a similiar sort of role to increase my depth/expertise . How does it affect both short term and long term career . Would I be limiting my options if and when I switch say 2 years down the line .
How complex would can my work get if all I am doing is writing SQL queries is also something bothering me , I could be wrong . I am looking for your guidance .

Currently I am more inclinced to Company B with a 65 % inclination .

title: Java Developer in Pakistan
content:
As a **Java developer** with **3 years** of experience in **Pakistan**, your compensation can vary based on factors such as your skills, location, and the specific company you work for. Let’s explore the average salary ranges for Java developers in Pakistan:

PayScale reports that the average base salary for a **Java Developer in Pakistan is Rs 737,341 per year**. Here’s a breakdown:
10th percentile: Around PKR 149,000 per year.
Median (50th percentile): Approximately PKR 737,000 per year.
90th percentile: Up to PKR 3 million per year.
SalaryExpert estimates the average gross salary for a **Java developer in Pakistan to be Rs 2,532,716 per year**. This includes both base salary and any bonuses.
Indeed provides data based on reported salaries:
Average base salary: Rs 61,948 per month.
Keep in mind that this figure represents the average across various experience levels and companies.
Remember that these figures are averages, and individual compensation can vary based on factors like your specific skills, certifications, and the company’s policies. It’s essential to research salary trends in your specific location and industry to negotiate a fair compensation package.

title: Schneider Electric | AI Engineer | Compensation
content:
I am writing this to inform job seekers to have an idea on the compensation provided by SE.
Schneider Electric is a multinational corporation specializing in energy management and automation solutions. Headquartered in France, Schneider Electric operates in over 100 countries and offers a wide range of products and services for various industries, including energy management, automation, and electrical distribution. With a focus on sustainability and innovation, Schneider Electric is a leading provider of solutions for efficiency and sustainability in energy management.

I interviewed for an AI enginner here. The inteview process had a total of 4 rounds. 3 tech and 1 HR.
Overall the panel members ask you questions based on DSA and development knowledge. As I was applying for AI engineer. I was asked about some extra topics like gpt, LUIS, NLP and NLU, some of the use cases I have worked on in my previous company.
The compensation provided was 26 LPA which is a great package. There are many additional benifits like WESOPs etc.

Like the post if it added some value to your job search.

title: leetcode
content:
One positive aspect of LeetCode is its comprehensive platform for coding practice and interview preparation. LeetCode offers a wide range of coding problems, spanning various difficulty levels and topics, which helps users strengthen their problem-solving skills and gain confidence in coding.

Additionally, LeetCode provides detailed problem descriptions, sample test cases, and discussions, enabling users to understand problem requirements thoroughly and learn from others' approaches and solutions.

Moreover, LeetCode frequently updates its problem set, introducing new challenges and keeping the content fresh and relevant to current industry standards and interview trends.

Overall, LeetCode serves as an invaluable resource for individuals looking to enhance their coding abilities, prepare for technical interviews, and advance their careers in software engineering and related fields.

title: Amazon | SDE1 | 2024 | India Bangalore
content:
Position : **Software Development Engineer**
Company : **Amazon**
Location : Bangalore, India
YOE : 0 (new grad)
Batch : 2023
Offcampus offer from Tier 3 college
PPO received after 6 months SDE internship but was on hold due to recession, full time offer received in March 2024

Compensation breakdown : 

* Base Pay (INR) : 1,917,000
* Sign-on Bonus Year 1 (INR) : 647,000
* Sign-on Bonus Year 2 (INR) : 518,000
   *The sign-on bonus is paid in monthly installments for both years.*
* Relocation allowance (one-time) (INR) : 150,000
* Restricted Stock Unit Value (RSU) (4 years) * (INR) : 1,556,000
*The RSU vesting cycle is 5% after Year 1, 15% after Year 2; and thereafter, 20% every six months until fully vested.*

Other benefits includes : 

* Home internet reimbursement for up to INR 1,250 per month.
* Meal card of INR 1,100 per month.
* Medical insurance cover of INR 5,00,000 (family floater) for you and your dependents (spouse and up to two children).
* Accident insurance cover for up to a maximum of three times annual base pay.
* Life insurance cover for up to a maximum of four times annual base pay.
* Annual health check which helps identify potential issues related to daily nutrition, fitness, and lifestyle habits.

title: WFA startup v/s Walmart - delta of time and comp
content:
it is like bird in hand v/s 10 in the bush. 

i have an offer from a small startup and it is WFA, but 60L base and 5L perf bonus(subject to passing probation as far exceeding) and paper money that too will be decided how well I fare in 3mon probation. my appraisal will also be in Jun25 while they have twice a year cycle but didn't make me eligible for as a prorated. 

only advantage is WFA and somewhere I benefit from it given I have small kids and can take care of parents well who need some medical assistance 

on the other hand, there's Walmart, 
60L base
12 bonus
25Lpa yearly RSUs(3 years actually, but there are refreshers at Walmart every year, worth same as RSUs)
but would want me to mostly relocate or somehow ensure 2 days a week working. 

the bigger tangential angle here is of time-

Apr 1 is when I am pegged to join that startup, and Apr 1 is also whrn Walmart might barely roll any offer and peg my joining in mid of April. 

what should I do?
a.) accept WFA startup and resume on Apr 1, and basis how Walmart pans out, put papers? can the startup nab me legally or force me to serve NP before I can join Walmart?

b.) join startup on Apr. 1and basis how Walmart pans out, I negotiate with startup fot another 10L base?

c.) dont join remote startup at all, presuming Walmart will sooner than later indeed roll out an offer and make me join albeit all is verbal ATM?

other details:
teir-1.5(non top 7 IITs) grad
10 yoe
desig at startup - sde4/staff
desig at Walmart -
staff/IN5

apologies for unstructured post, typing from phone. can furnish more details as need be.

UPDATE:
Going with WFA startup option. Reason: personal family constraints, because Walmart isnt 95L, it is higher 70s and higher 80s for 1st and 2nd year. I have small kids, and dependent parents, dont want them to be brought to a stupid city like BLR at this point of time.

title: Project 44 Interview Experience
content:
company : Project44 
Position : SDE 
yoe - 1.9

applied via referrals , so recruiter skipped hackerrank test.

Round 1 **PS/DS**
1. Find  water cell with maximum path sum from that cell to nearest island in binary matrix ( 0 for water and 1 for island) 

2.Find the peak element in the array in logn

Round 2 **advanced DSA**
1. Given a matrix of 0 and 1 , o denotes empty cell and 1 denotes stone, a player starting from top left corner has to finally come down to bottom right corner of matrix and the player cannot move across stone, and can only walk rightward or downward. Find if there is a possibility to stop the player from reaching from top left corner to bottom right corner by placing just one single stone somewhere . return true of false based on that.

Round 3 **System Design**
deep dive into my current project, talked about scalability as well.
1. Design SkyScanner expectations were database schema and how to scale it for millions of users
2. What is Saga Pattern in microservice architecture.


Verdict 
HR called and conveyed that they have already made commitment to another user as i postponed my interviews 2 times , however i got positive feedback from all rounds, they said, they will reach to me in 2 weeks if something comes up and let me go through direct HM round if possible.

title: TCS Hiring Drive at Electrinic City Bangalore
content:
I had litrally **worst experience** at **TCS Hiring Drive**.

Recruitment team called me before 1 week for F2F Interview with TCS & took all my details along with resume.
I got mail from them about time and place for F2F Interview. 

On 9th March 2024:

Time was 9 - 12:30 AM & Everyone were standing in line outside of tcs building.
Security Gaurd said HR haven't came yet so please stand outside. 

At 10:30 HR Came and I went inside. 

1) Everyone were sitted in line and the management was damn worst.

People with all tec & non tech experience were comming and there was no resume shortlisted round so everyone were elible which should not be like this.

2) I gave my first round. I cleared it. I answered 100% questions and all correct.
3) Begore 2nd round the management team sent me to one room where background verification takes place. After spending 1 hour over there. One member from management comes and tells me that i need to sit in some other room.
4) I went to another room and there were in total 4 people all from java background having experience <= 4 Years.
5) Then one person from management team comes and says all the person who are sitted here have not performed well in 1st round. It was impossible for me to digest because I have given all correct answers and interviewer even said that you have cleared this round. I told him I cant believe this , you might have got wrong information.  He said let me check giveme 10 mins.
6) After waiting for 30 mins, I went to my 1st interviewer, I asked that you said I have cleared my first round right. He said yes, but HR said that we are only hiring for 5+ YOE , I said then why to wste my and your time then?
7) I then took this thing and explained it to head of management team. He was nice, he listened everything patiently and said you don't have to worry and your candidature will not get closed.
8) I gave my 2nd round and then did background verification.


Tip: Never go to TCS Hiring Drive if you are confident on your skills. Take virtual or individual Interview rounds.

title: Schlumberger (PITC) Pune Interview Experience – Internship 2019
content:
Compensation during internship - 17k per month with hotel stay and office pickup and drop.
PPO offer - 9.5LPA (back in 2020)

Schlumberger gave a visit to my Campus for recruiting 3rd year Btech students as interns for different roles.  They outsourced the initial shortlisting to FirstNaukri.com and hence the first two rounds were taken by First Naukri.  

**Round 1 - Coding and Aptitude :**

Doable aptitude questions - Time and work, reasoning, couple of speed distance questions and other easy aptitude questions.
Medium level Coding question - only one - Mirror a binary tree

**Round 2 - Telephonic Interview :**

This was quite abrupt so be prepared for it before hand, I received the call outof the blue.
The Interview was more about getting a feel of how good I am at my communication, academics and a bit of evaluation of how good I sound technically.
I basically gave the interviewer whole picture of what I did in my 3 years of college, I focused on my participation in clubs and chapters, the workshops that I had conducted and other achievements of my college life.

**Round 3 - Technical Interview :**

After clearing the first two rounds I had a hangout call for the technical Interview.
I had a lot in my resume, so the interviewer was busy evaluating me using that only. He asked about my projects and other internships that I did, the challenges that I faced and how I overcame all the hindrances.
For others, the interview did ask them a lot from DSA, DBMS ( many SQL commands as well). (Yes, I was lucky that my interviewer didn't ask me these).
He asked me few questions like "Do you prefer Microsoft technologies or Google technologies?" I wasn't sure which one the company used so I gave a diplomatic answer saying, "It depends on the application and the better technology present at that time, obviously that can be found out by a little research"

**Round 4 - HR :**

The HR interview was also on a hangout call, it was also abrupt, I got a call asking me if I am available and had the interview call just 5 minutes later.
The HR interview was very casual, I almost repeated what I told the interviewer in the telephonic round.
The HR was friendly and we had a couple of chuckles until it was over.

Present Update - I completed my 2 months internship, did 3 projects while I was there, my whole team and manger were happy. I also received a Pre Placement Offer.

title: SDE II in Amazon Toronto - Potentially being seriously lowballed
content:
Hi guys,

I recently accepted an offer for SDE II at Amazon Toronto. I haven't been assigned a team yet but while talking with the recruiter and the someone from the offer team I got the distinct feeling that I was being seriously lowballed.

The lady from the offer team told me this is what the they offer SDE II's in toronto at the moment :

1. Base comp - between CAD 130K and CAD 140K (I currently make CAD 138K as a Tech Lead at RBC)

2. Total comp - between CAD 195K and CAD 215K 

3. RSUs - between 400 and 500

4. Sign on bonus - the difference 

I have 9+ years of experience working as a developer (I've worked in India, the US & Canada) - 4+ years of experience being a tech lead - and my highest level of Education is a masters in computer science from a mid-rank public University in the US 

Is this a fair market rate or am I being lowballed because I told them that I don't have any other competing offers right now (which is the truth because the market for well paying tech jobs is in the dumps right now in toronto - I haven't been getting any call backs from any other place - this and intuit were the only 2 places that called me back - and I got ghosted by the Intuit Recruiter midway)

I told her I won't settle for anything less than 160K-180K base and 215K-235K total but she kept telling me that this is the best they can offer especially because I got downgraded from SDE III during the interview process (apparently they'll only hire you if you're 50% better than the people they have on site)

 I have a feeling this ain't gonna go in my favor.

Would love some feedback from any SDEII's currently working at amazon toronto or who recently got an offer for this at amazon toronto.

What can I do to not get lowballed in this situation?

title: Flipkart | SDE-1 | Bangalore | 2024
content:
**Education:**
B.Tech CSE, Tier 2 private college.

**Years of Experience:** 6 month internship at a FAANGMULA company
**Date of the Offer:** March 2024
**Company**: Flipkart 
**Title/Level:** Software Development Engineer 1
**Location:** Bangalore, India

**TOTAL CTC:** 32,57,000

**Salary:** 18 lakhs base
**Relocation:** 40k cash + 40k in travel/hotel allowances
**Signing Bonus:** 3 lakhs - with first month salary
**Retention Bonus:** 3 lakhs - at start of second year
**Stock bonus:** 5.07 lakhs ESOPs - evenly over 4 years
**Variable Pay:** 1.8 lakhs
**Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock) for year 1:** ~24.8 lakhs 
**Benefits:** 1.69 lakhs (2200 meal card, insurance, wellness, retirement, etc.)

**Other details:** 
Signing and Retention bonuses have a clawback period of 2 and 1 years resp.
Flipkart hasn't IPOed so take the stock values with a grain of salt.
Was pleasantly surprised with Flipkart's compensation structure. It is only about a lakh lower than the FAANGMULA company I interned at, so pretty much top of the range for fresh graduates. (Even though the CTC looks much higher at FAANG due to backloaded stocks, the amount you get is same in first 2 years)

**Interview Experience:** [Same hiring drive and process as this post](https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-question/4839315/flipkart-sde-1-interview-experience-2024).
